La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Kunan Llankarisum" village bank. This bank is located in the district of Huayopata, belonging to the La Convención province and Cusco department. The member is Luzmila, she is married, 64, and has 6 children. The member works in her business growing fruits. The member has land where she grows bananas, coffee, mandarins and oranges. The member works from 6:00 AM until 5:00 PM. The member already has various years' experience in this business and it's going very well for her. The dream of this member is to increase her land for growing. The member applies for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The member that is with a covered face doesn't belong to the Kunan Llankarisum village bank. The other members work at the businesses of selling animals, agriculture, grocery store and food sales. The member thanks those who form part of this dream through these means and she commits to fulfilling the payment of her loan installments in the established time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man from Irbid city. He tried to work in addition to studying but ‎he could not find a suitable job. Now he is a student in university majoring in software ‎engineering. He wants to complete his studies and find a good job.‎

Mohammad has two siblings that cause his family financial problems and his father ‎cannot cover the education fees in addition to the household expenses.
‎
Therefore, Mohammad applied for an education loan to help him pay the university fees for ‎this semester and buy the books that he needs.‎

loans.use: to cover his next semester's fees .

loans.name: Gerson Jonathan

texts.es: Gerson de 24 años de edad, es una persona quien vive de manera humilde junto a sus padres en vivienda propia donde tiene 15 años de residir. Gerson es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, él ofrece sus servicios en una empresa que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad y de esta manera puede satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. La casa en la que habita es humilde y necesita unas reparaciones y así también necesita la instalación de ventanas debido a que su casa no tiene, también necesita un cabio de puerta ya que la que tiene  actualmente es muy frágil e insegura. Es por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, ventanas, una puerta y pago de mano de obra para encementar el piso del corredor de la casa y la instalación de la puerta y las ventanas. De esta forma ofrecer una mejor condición de vida a sus padres y una mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Gerson, 24 years old, is a person who lives in a humble manner with his parents in their own home where he's been residing for 15 years. Gerson is a very responsible and hardworking person, he offers his services in a business that's found near his community and, in this manner, can satisfy the basic needs of his family.

The house in which he lives is humble and needs some repairs and therefore also needs the installation of windows since his house doesn't have them. He also needs a change of door since the one he currently has is fragile and insecure. This is why he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, windows, a door and labor to cement the hallway floor of the house and install doors and windows. In this manner, it will offer a better living condition to his parents and better security.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, windows, a door and labor to cement the hallway floor of the house and install doors and windows.

loans.name: Eva Esmeralda

texts.es: Eva de 25 años de edad, tiene 8 años de residir en vivienda propia, dentro de la cual vive al lado de sus hijos de 2 y 9 años y su compañero de vida. Ella es una persona que se esfuerza día a día en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza el cual tiene 2 años de administrar y es el que le permite sostener la economía del hogar, y cubrir con esto las necesidades básicas de su familia. Debido al tiempo que tiene de administrar el negocio ha crecido la cantidad de clientes, y con ello la demanda de los productos, es por esto que Eva continua feliz con sus ventas. Así  también su compañero de vida le ayuda con la economía del hogar. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida Eva solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, clavos y pago de mano de obra para cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda. Ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones y desea repararlo para ofrecerles una mejor vivienda a sus hijos.
texts.en: Eva is 25 years old. She has lived 8 years in her own house, where she lives with her children, 2 and 9, and her life partner. She is a person who struggles day by day in her business selling beauty items, which she has had for two years. This is what allows her to support her household finances and to pay for her family's basic needs. Due to the long time she has had her business, the number of her customers has grown, and with it the demand of her products. For that reason, Eva continues being happy with her sales.  Also, her life partner helps her with the household finances. In order to improve her quality of life, Eva is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: metal sheets, wood, nails, and to pay for hand labor to change the roof of her house's hallway because it is in bad condition, and she wants to repair it to offer a better house to her children.

loans.use: to invest in: metal sheets, wood, nails, and to pay for hand labor to change the roof of her house's hallway.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

Sajida aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she at present owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he foresees yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this 35,102 NGN loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from its marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2000 USD per hectare. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get university educations.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest, then sell it later for up to 37% more in profits.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is forty years old and a hardworking woman who has five children. She is a tailor who is also adept at embroidery. She is known locally for her skills in this area.

Humaira’s work pulled the family out of a financial crisis it was facing when she started working. Since then she has established a good clientele.

Humaira has requested a 50,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner Kashf. She intends to buy a new sewing machine plus some spools of thread and lace for meeting the needs of her customers on a consistent basis. She aspires to save money toward a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine plus some spools of thread and lace.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Con 44 años de edad, Concepción es madre soltera y vive con sus hijos de 8 y 11 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida con el negocio de venta de tortillas que maneja en su comunidad. Negocio el cual administra desde hace 5 años, y gracias a esa cantidad de años ha logrado aumentar sus ventas y ha logrado que muchos la prefieran. Gracias a este negocio Concepción puede sacar adelante a su familia. Y en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida Concepción solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, lamina, madera y pago de mano de obra para encementar el piso y reparar el techo de su vivienda. De esta manera ofrecer una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. También Concepción se encuentra muy agradecida son el crédito que se le otorgó anteriormente ya que gracias a ello pudo invertir en insumos para su negocio, permitiendo de esta manera maximizar las ventas de tortillas.
texts.en:
44-year-old Concepcion is a single mother who lives with her children ages 8 and 11. She works selling tortillas in her community. She has had this business for 5 years and has been able to increase her sales and obtain her customers loyalty thanks to her experience. This business has allowed Concepcion to get her family ahead. 

With the goal of improving her quality of life, Concepcion is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, aluminum sheets, wood and to pay for the labor required to cement the floor and repair the roof of her home. This will allow her to offer better living conditions to her children. Concepcion is also very thankful for the loan that she received before, as it allowed her to invest in supplies for her business, which led her to maximizing her tortilla sales.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, aluminum sheets, wood and to pay for the labor to cement the floor and repair her home's roof.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentin con 42 años edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. valentin cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Valentin se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de maíz, el cuál se encuentra con 25 y 40 días de sembrado, dichos productos son comercializados en el distrito de san Felipe. valentin cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar como son yuca, fréjol, etc. Los cuáles son para su consumo.El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz.De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Valentin es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, este es su quinto crédito.
texts.en:
Valentin is 42 years old, is in a civil union, and lives with his wife and children in the San Felipe district, Jaen province, Cajamarca department, in Peru.
Valentin has very good references that live in his district, both personal, as well as financial. The majority of the town's population work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock farming.
Valentin works in agriculture. He grows corn, which takes 25 to 40 days to plant. The crops are sold in the San Felipe district. Valentin has more than 10 years of experience in this industry. Additionally, he grows crops such as yucca, beans, etc, which are grown for his personal use.
This loan will be used to invest in the upkeep of his corn crops. This way he will be able to make enough money to improve his quality of life.
Valentin has been a client of the Edpyme Alternativa before. This is his fifth loan.

loans.use: to invest in the upkeep of his corn growing business.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is a Kiva borrower. He operates a farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy fertilizer to boost production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to boost production

loans.name: Selva

texts.en: Selva is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. Her business goal is to open a cereals store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 31 years old housekeeper, from village Tolenji. She lives with her family members, from whom her father and brother are breadwinners. They are involved in private activities and get small income. In order to get the financial independence and have her own income, Nana decided to start trading business. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her family's unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.

After several unsuccessful attempts, Nana applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. With the requested amount, Nana plans to go to Turkey occasionally and purchase stock of various kind clothing at wholesale prices. She will sell it locally in increased prices and also get private orders from her loyal costumers.
Nana rely on a good will of Kiva lenders and will be very thankful for the chance to generate her own income and make better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing and start trading.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a hard working lady. Everyday increasing expenditures compelled her to initiate her own business of milk selling. She is a 47-year-old married woman.

She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Nusrat ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. They also sell animals on a seasonal basis to generate an additional income.

However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Nusrat has requested a 45,000 PKR loan to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers in order to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 25-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and two children, all of them are still attending school. Her husband works as a car blacksmith and work tirelessly to be always ready to ensure her family a good life. Today, she looks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational installment fees. This is Mariam second loan from Kiva and definitely, this will help her to ensure them a good education path.

loans.use: o pay her children’s educational installment fees

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis con 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijo,vive en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de San Andrés, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Luis cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría al cultivo de frutales, café, maíz y hortalizas.

Luis se dedica al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 hectáreas, variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación está en tercer año de producción tiene cuatro años de edad, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café porque anteriormente a cultivado variedad nacional y ahora cultiva Catimor. Adicionalmente Luis se dedica al cultivo de productos de pan llevar (plátano, yuca), también cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros).El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 hectárea de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida de él y la de su familia.

Luis es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con cónyuge.
texts.en:
47-year-old Luis lives with his common law partner and their son in their own house built with rustic materials in the district of San Andres, province of Cutervo, region of Cajamarca, Peru. Luis has very good personal and work references in the region. The inhabitants of his community primarily work growing fruits, coffee, corn and vegetables. 

Luis grows coffee in the 2 hectares of land that he owns. He grows the catimore variety, which is more resistant to infections and plagues. His plot of land has been producing for the past three years. He has experience growing coffee as he has previously grown the national variety. Luis also grow some plantains and yucca and raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs). He will use the loan to maintain his 1-hectare plot of land and grow cofee, with the hopes of ensuring a good crop in 2016, which will be reflected in higher sales and a higher income. This will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family. 

Luis belongs to the Edpyme Alternative association.

loans.use: to maintain his 1-hectare plot of land and grow cofee, with the hopes of ensuring a good crop in 2016.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: He is 35 years old, married and blessed with two children.He has borrowed loan to purchase more clothing and do farming, hoping this will generate income.This is her seventh year in business.His hopes and dreams in future is to grow the business, feed his family and pay school fees.

loans.use: to  purchase clothing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking single lady living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy crates of soda and beer to sell. She now lives with two other people who are her relatives and the whole responsibility of providing for them rests on her. She still runs a bar, which she has been operating for the last four years.

She started as a waitress in small bar before starting her own bar, because she was tired of working in people's bars. She has dreams of building her own house for a residence and business, though she has other responsibilities of paying school fees for the children she lives with. Mary is willing to do business, expand and care for all those who need her help, but her main problems are high rental and license fees on top of inadequate capital.

Mary is requesting a loan to buy more drinks like crates of beer and soda to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Costance

texts.en:
Costance is a hardworking lady with 5 children living in Fort Portal Uganda and has a business of growing a green leaf, locally called Mairungi. Her business started in 2000 with a vision of getting more income. She faces challenges of inadequate capital especially funds to pay workers which labor is expensive.

However, she is working very hard to make sure she educates all her children to higher levels of learning and expand her farm to a bigger scale. She has asked for a loan to plant more green leaf Mairungi.

loans.use: to plant more green leaf of Mairungi

loans.name: Sagir

texts.en:
Sagir is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Sagir has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Sagir would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Sagir can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Sagir will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Sagir is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 39-year-old working woman who has children. After her marriage, she felt that she should help support her family in order to improve its financial condition. So she started a business selling fabric.

Farzana is well-known among her neighbors for the material she offers and has a good client list. Currently she has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR through Kiva's field partner Kashf to buy good-quality fabric of different colors, feeling she could earn substantial profits through such an investment. This would lead to an ever-increasing improvement in life for her family.

Farzana believes working earns her respect. She also knows that a good education for her children will result in a better future for them.

loans.use: to buy good-quality fabric of different colors to offer her clients.

loans.name: Rahmeh

texts.en:
Rahmeh is a young lady of 22 years old; she is single and lives in West Irbid. Rahmeh is ‎currently studying for her BA in university, majoring in Arabic language.‎

She said that her biggest inspiration to move forward is her parents; she wants to support ‎them financially in order to improve their quality of life.‎

She applied for an education loan to cover her semester fees and graduate as soon as ‎possible to find a good job with good salary to improve her life and her income.‎

loans.use: to pay her university fees for a BA in Arabic Language

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana has been doing a business of shoe-making for many years. She is an energetic person and eager to support her family.

She is responsible for taking care of the basic necessities of her children, including food, health and clothing. She is also accountable for improving their standard of living.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she is fulfilling her dreams and is able to manage her children’s education. Now she requested a 50,000 PKR loan to buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc.

In this way, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and, hence, better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 59-year-old woman. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase-and-sell business.

She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs, from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Rasheeda expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Alhaji Bello

texts.en:
Alhaji Bello is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Bello is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Alhaji Bello would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Bello will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Alhaji Bello now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a 36 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and five children who are still studying. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time, as per her husband, he is the main income provider in the family and working so hard to help his beloved family to live in good conditions.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school

loans.name: La Amistad De California Group

texts.es: Margot tiene 31 años de edad es soltera con tres hijos dependientes. Ella implemento su bazar en su vivienda hace muchos años en el cual ofrece zapatos sandalias para damas y caballeros de toda estación. Ella aprendió dicha actividad desde muy pequeña. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sandalias para damas y caballeros. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Margot es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en: Margot is 31 years old. She is single with three dependent children. She started her bazaar in her house many years ago. There, she offers women and men shoes and sandals for all seasons. She learned this activity since she was very young. She will invest the loan to buy sandals for women and men. The group is grateful to the KIVA lenders for the given loan. Margot is the first one on the right side.

loans.use: to buy sandals for women and men.

loans.name: Pauson

texts.en:
Pauson is a hardworking married and trustworthy man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more farm inputs like seedlings, fertilizer & manure to add to his farm.

He lives with five other dependents who are his relatives and is a good second-time borrower of Hofokam Limited.

He now grazes cattle as a major source of livelihood, alongside crop growing, produce selling and a retail shop to earn extra income. Pauson has engaged in these various sources of income for the last 20 years and with that experience, he believes he can do better in the near future by diversifying to other businesses, like expanding the retail shop to serve as an extra source of income, though he faces a challenge of prolonged droughts that leave no pasture for his animals, leading to less or no milk for sale at all.

He needs a loan to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.name: Qais

texts.en:
Qais is 20 years old and lives in Ramtha with his family which consists of eight members, which ‎means that he attends to a big family.‎

Qais is a student in university, majoring in medical physics in his second year. He hopes to find ‎suitable work with a good income to help his siblings with their education fees, because his ‎father`s income is not enough to cover all these expenses.‎

Because of the financial situation that his family is facing, he decided to apply for a loan to ‎help him pay his university fees and achieve his dreams.‎

loans.use: to pay his university fees and buy what he needs to complete his education.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a 34-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal Uganda, and has a business of farming, growing eucalyptus, and dealing in motorcycle transport which he has been running for 15 years.

He started this activity with a vision of employing himself to earn income. He has a vision of buying a car for the taxi transport business as a way of boosting his incomes despite the challenge of the rampant motorcycle theft in his area. Kenneth needs a loan to buy seedlings of eucalyptus trees for planting.

loans.use: to buy seedlings of eucalyptus trees for planting

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a promising and hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates butcher shop which business he has been doing for over the last ten years.

In addition to the butcher shop, Jackson also grows food crops where he sells the surplus to get other family needs. He has responsibilities of looking after his family and paying school fees for his children.

Jackson aspires to increase his household income and educate all his children to a minimum qualification of a degree because he believes so much in education for his children to have a bright future.

He faces challenges of inadequate capital to meet his dream and empower his business. Jackson is therefore requesting for a loan to buy more cows and bulls to graze, then slaughter for his store.

loans.use: to buy more cows and bulls to graze then slaughter for his store

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 49 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and daughter in Zugdidi district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have 0.5 hectare agricultural land, which is cultivated seasonally and they grow fruits and vegetables. Nana decided to to trading business and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3200 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of nuts and will resell at higher price. This will give her a chance to increase family income and improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to begin trade in nuts so as to increase family income.

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en:
Lawal is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Lawal has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Lawal can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Lawal will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Lawal is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Subhendu Kumar

texts.en:
Subhendu is a 38 years old differently-abled man who hails from a small village in Salepur, Odisha, India. He has been running a betel shop and a rice mill simultaneously for the past five years.

He is a married man with one son who is currently pursuing his study in a primary school. Subhendu is a man of immense patience and determination. His strong will power have never let him break down in hard situations. Being the only bread winner of the family, Subhendu struggles really very hard in order to earn and sustain his livelihood.

He is requesting a loan of 24,000 INR to expand his betel shop and his rice mill and add more stocks to his betel shop so that he will be able to generate higher sales and enjoy a better standard of living.

Subhendu has a dream of providing his only son the best education and see him become successful.

loans.use: to expand his betel shop and his rice mill and add more stocks to his betel shop.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Yahaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Yahaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a 22-year-old single man. He is a student in university, majoring in Computer ‎Information Systems. He chose this major because he believes that he will finds good work in ‎this field.
He is acquiring a Youth loan to help him to pay for his university fees. Malek appreciatess your ‎kindness. ‎

loans.use: to cover his semester fees for a BSc. in Computer Information Systems.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Saidu

texts.en:
Alhaji Saidu is a Babban Gona farmer. Alhaji Saidu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Alhaji Saidu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, Alhaji Saidu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Alhaji Saidu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Alhaji Saidu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to repair his house or move into a bigger home, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en: Sameh is 30, married, and has one daughter and an infant. He has a small electric devices project and is requesting 10,000 EGP loan to buy LCDs and some kitchen supplies such as dishes.

loans.use: to buy LCDs and some kitchen supplies such as dishes. .

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer from Gidan Mai Bindiga village. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 88 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Haruna will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Haruna no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Haruna hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes,kale, onions, cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, kale, cabbages and other items. Her business goal is to be distributing vegetables to supermarkets, schools within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, kale, cabbages and other items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions ,cabbages and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes,cabbages and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes,cabbages and other items

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, salt,bread, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, milk and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, milk and other items

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is married with two children; one attends school in Bundibugyo, Uganda. In 2000 he began trading mainly in cocoa so as to take care of his family's needs. He also farms and makes bricks for additional income. 

He got a loan of Shs500,000  through Kiva's field partner HOFOKAM to buy more cocoa beans to sell and achieve his  dreams of expanding his cocoa business into new markets so he could send his children to university and build a good house. He has made good strides in cocoa trade  and wishes to continue in business to raise more income for his family. Eric is asking for a loan to buy cocoa for resale ahead of the peak season.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale ahead of the peak season.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen is a 29 year old hardworking married woman with two children aged 2 and 10 years. She lives in Kamwenge, Uganda where one of her children attends primary school. Apart from her own children, she also lives with an extra person who works as a domestic worker. Moureen deals in the selling of electronic devices like batteries, phones and phone accessories.

Though it is a related business, she also sells Newspapers and airtime to earn an extra income and works all days in the week. She has been doing the two businesses for over eight years so as to earn a living and have improved life standards in her family. Her clients are various companies, the local community around her. She has a vision of expanding her shop but her main challenge is high inflation rates.

Moureen is seeking for a loan to buy more phones, phone accessories and other electric appliances to sell.

loans.use: to buy more phones, phone accessories and other electric appliances to sell.

loans.name: Shamsuddeen

texts.en:
Shamsuddeen is a maize farmer from Sarkin Fada village. As a Babban Gona member, Shamsuddeen is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Shamsuddeen would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Shamsuddeen will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Shamsuddeen no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Shamsuddeen hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Ibrahim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Chrissie

texts.en:
Chrissie firmly believes through hard work and being an entrepreneur, she has a chance to build a good future for herself. She is 21 years old and is the second born in a family of four. Family is very important to Chrissie, it is for this reason that upon completion of her high school, she went straight into business so that she could help her parents with the daily household needs. Chrissie runs a small cosmetics shop in the market and would like to grow her business by adding Zoona Mobile money transfers. She needs a loan to make this happen.

Chrissie is going to set up her Zoona mobile money transfer business Kasungu, Malawi. She is very excited to bring the service to her community as it will her people in her community have easy access to financial services. The majority of Malawians still remain unbanked and this service is vital.

With this loan, Chrissie will be able to pay for her set up costs such as buying small trolley where she can serve customers and a web-enabled phone which is the platform used to make the actual transactions. The funds will also insure that Chrissie is able to make pay-outs when customers need to receive money and that she has electronic float to enable customers who need to send money.

Chrissie is grateful for the opportunity to start running her own business and improve her standard of living. She says it’s currently a struggle to help support her family and is hopeful that by adding mobile money transfers, it will get much easier.

loans.use: to pay for her set up costs such as buying small trolley, a web enabled phone and having the cash at hand needed to serve people in Kasungu who are in need of financial services

loans.name: Dallal

texts.en: Dallal is a 37 year old married woman. She is living with her husband and four children, all of them are still attending school. She is a housewife where she is dedicated from her home and family. Her husband is the main income provider but his income is barely sufficient. That’s why, today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l; she will be utilizing the loan to pay her children’s educational fees.  She said that this loan will surely helped her to insure the school year for them what makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is 29 years old, married and blessed with 2 children.

He sells timber in wholesale, a business he has done for the last 6 years .

Onesmus has borrowed a loan to purchase timber for sale hoping this will generate additional income.

His hopes and dreams in future is to grow the business and pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase timber for sale

loans.name: Naimeh

texts.en:
Naimeh is conservative woman and asked her daughter Alaa to take her place instead her.‎
Naimeh is a married mother of three children who has been working for many years as a ‎teacher to be able help her husband, who is employed with a limited monthly salary, in ‎covering their family's living needs.
‎
Naimeh is a hardworking woman and a caring mother, she wants to see her children a ‎successful people in the future. She is acquiring a loan to pay for her daughter Alaa who is ‎studying for a BSc. in hospital management.‎

loans.use: to pay for her daughter`s university fees for a BSc. in Hospital Management

loans.name: Wendy Aracely

texts.es:
Wendy, de 32 años de edad, está soltera y no tiene hijos todavía, ella vive junto a su madre y su hermana en su casa; su madre trabaja vendiendo paletas artesanales en su casa. 

Wendy, trabaja como cajera en una empresa de telecomunicaciones, ella tiene varios años de trabajar en esa empresa, pero siempre quiso tener el negocio en su casa; ahora ya tienen 10 meses de trabajar en su casa con la venta de paletas. 

Wendy, necesita el préstamo para surtir más su tienda y para comprar frutas, saborizantes y otros utensilios para la elaboración de las paletas. 

Los sueños de Wendy, son poder hacer crecer su pequeño negocio y así poder obtener buenos ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Wendy is 32 years old. She is single and does not have children yet. She lives with her mother and sister in their house. Her mother works selling handmade popsicles from her house. Wendy works as a cashier at a telecommunications company. She has worked for many years in this company, but she always wanted to have a business in her house. Now, they already have ten months working in her house selling popsicles. Wendy needs the loan to stock up more her store, and to buy fruits, flavorings and other utensils to make popsicles. Wendy's dreams are to make her small business grow and in this way, to be able to get good income for the well being of her family.

loans.use: to stock up more her store, and to buy fruits, flavorings, and other utensils to make popsicles.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida  is 50 years old, a married woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Rashida  has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants  to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is 43, married to a housewife and has 2 school children; one son and one daughter. He has a small fattening project and is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle for fattening to increase his sales of milk, cheese and butter and sell the calves.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle for his fattening project

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He also takes care of four other relatives who live with him.

He used his previous loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his banana plantation. He grows crops as a main source income and has been farming for more than 20 years. He gives technical advice to his district as a Councillor and also owns the whole responsibility of looking after his children plus providing education to them.

Ismail intends to expand his gardens into a modern farm, construct a better residential house, and also increase his household income but his main setbacks, like those of other farmers in Uganda, are bad weather and inadequate capital.

Ismail is requesting a loan to buy more manure and fertilizers for his gardens.

loans.use: to buy more manure and fertilizer for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en:
Baraa is the person who is really worked hard to achieve her dreams by owning a beauty salon.‎ She is still working as a hairdresser but finally in her own salon.

She was able to start ‎working on her business after she took the second loan to open her independent beauty ‎salon. She already has a lot of customers.

Baraa is the caring mother of two children and she is ‎married to a poor man, though actually they live comfortably with each other. She wants ‎to improve her standards of living.

Therefore she is requesting a loan to be able to fix her ‎salon up well to attract more clients and create a pleasant atmosphere that her clients will ‎enjoy and to buy hairdryer and more equipment.

She promises to once again pay on time ‎and thanks all the lenders for their continued support.‎

loans.use: to be able to fix her ‎salon up well and to buy a hairdryer.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a hardworking married man with eight children living in Kamwenge, Uganda.

He deals in cattle fattening and started this business thirty years ago. He was forced to start this practice due to the fact that his family’s standards of living were poor. He therefore needed to enhance his family income and educate all his offspring to higher levels.

His business is doing pretty well though it is limited by inadequate capital and the high rate of inflation which makes the animals so expensive to purchase. Francis hopes to use the required loan to stock more cows for fattening.

loans.use: to stock more cows for fattening.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is ambitious and patient. She got shocked after her father death, but she did not give ‎up her dreams and she decided to complete her father`s dream to see her as graduate ‎with excellent grade and find a good job with high salary.‎

Rawan is studying Sociology and lives in Irbid with her family. Her pension from her father is ‎not enough to cover her university fees, therefore she applied for an educational loan to ‎help pay for them and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to cover her semester fees for a BSc. in Sociology

loans.name: Santos Victor

texts.es:
Santos Victor con 57 años de edad de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos nietos a quienes apoya, en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Santos Victor se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café, de variedad catimor de 05 y 06 años de edad, cuenta con fincas fruteras de café en buen estado. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar, cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito es para invertir en la compra de abono y mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. De esta manera poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida él y la de su familia.

santos Victor es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, este es su octavo crédito.
texts.en:
Santos Victor is 57 years old and in a common-law relationship. He lives with his spouse and two grandchildren, who he supports, in the Cañaris district, Ferreñafe Province, department of Lambayeque, Peru. The inhabitants of this town work mostly in agriculture, commerce, and the cattle industry.

Santos Victor works in agriculture. He has coffee crops of the Catimor variety that are 5 and 6 years, and are in good condition. In addition, he farms basic agricultural food products. He has more than 20 years of experience in this line of work.

This loan is to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and maintenance of his coffee crops. In this way, he will be able to gain an acceptable profit to better his quality of life, as well as his family's.

Santos Victor is a returning borrower from Edpyme Alternativa. This is his eighth loan.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and maintenance of his coffee crops.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 52, married to a housewife, and has three sons and one daughter.

He has a small fattening project and previously requested a 5,000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on the due dates.

He is requesting a loan of 10,000 EGP to buy a head of cattle to sell the calves after fattening and increase his sales of milk, cheese, and butter and help his son with his marriage expenses.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique con 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Enrique cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Enrique se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con terreno agrícola, en la cuál posee fincas de café, variedad Catimor. Adicionalmente Enrique realiza labores de peón agrícola.Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y para el mantenimiento de su finca de café. De esta manera poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Enrique es socio nuevo en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Enrique is 24 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his spouse and his children in the district of Pomahuaca, Jaén province, in the department of Cajamarca, Perú. Enrique has very good references, both personal and for work. The inhabitants of this area work principally in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Enrique works in agriculture and owns land where he has a coffee plantation, growing Catimor varietal. Enrique also works as agricultural labor. He is requesting a loan to buy manure and to maintain his coffee plantation. In this way he can acquire an acceptable profit to improve his quality of living.

Enrique is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy manure and to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a 27-year-old married woman living with her husband and mother of three children. Her husband represents the main source of income for the family; he works as an employee in a local company and works also in parallel in the agriculture field. To help her husband, Dalia owns a wear cotton shop for extra income.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay her children educational fees. She is very eager to make use of the loan their professional career. This is her fourth loan, but she said that she will be a permanent client and eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children educational fees

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be risk taker. She operates a farm where she grows coffee. Her farm is located in a fertile area. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Asitajona

texts.en: Asitajona a mother of six children used the previous loan to buy cocoa seeds for resale. She trades in cocoa, mainly buying and selling to agents and cocoa companies in addition to incomes from farming and selling food stuffs like cassava and maize. She started the cocoa business from her small savings from selling food stuffs from her family garden with an inspiration to expand her business. She has been able to raise income for her family and to pay school fees for the children but is still challenged by limited capital. She hopes to expand the business, educate her children and support the family in getting basic needs. She intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is 43 years old and from the Sachkhere district. He has a pensioner father, school-aged daughter and son, and a wife who is a baker and gets approximately 150 GEL per month. Aleksandre is employed at a private company and gets a fixed salary. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Aleksandre decided to start his own private business and requested financial support among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions.

The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor to get loans for starting or restarting businesses. Aleksandre's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,000 USD for opening a bakery. He will purchase all needed equipment, renovate the place, and will make it a family business, which he thinks will be a profitable activity. The family will start selling baked products among local people and will have their own loyal customers. This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a bakery and make it a significant source of family income.

loans.name: Lota

texts.en:
You will be pleased to meet this hard-working entrepreneur named Lota from Matina, Davao City. She operates a variety store with a small eatery and owns a simple boarding house that she rents out to students and minimum-wage earners. Her boarders are also her customers in her eatery and variety store. However, they are also her usual debtors who request later payment for store items, food and boarding house rental. This practice minimizes her capital, and that is why she wants to avail herself of additional capital amounting to PHP 50,000. She can use it to cover her collectibles, and to buy assorted grocery items, beverages, sacks of rice, and ingredients for her recipes.

Lota is a widow who has two children. She was able to raise them well. One of them is already working and the other is completing his college degree. Her children are her consultants when it comes to improving her business. They plan to develop her store into a grocery store with an adjacent restaurant and convert her boarding house into units of apartment for rent.

Every week, Lota meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items, beverages, sacks of rice, and ingredients for her recipes

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María, de 58 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, está soltera y vive con su hija la más pequeña, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad pero emigraron hacia Estados Unidos en busca de mejores oportunidades; ella vive en su casa donde también tiene su negocio. 

María, tiene una tienda de productos alimenticios, golosinas y otros artículos de primera necesidad, ella lleva tiene más de 13 años de tener ese negocio; gracias a su tienda ha podido salir adelante y velar por su hija para que estudie y se gradué de bachillerato, su tienda es su principal fuente de ingresos.

María, necesita el préstamo para surtir la tienda con más productos como azúcar, café, aceite, etc. y otras cosas más que necesita para ofrecer a sus clientes y vender más y así obtener más ganancias. 

María, sueña con poder seguir trabajando en su tienda y también volver a ver a sus hijos.- También desea ver a su hija graduada y si se puede que continué con la universidad.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old. She is a hardworking single woman who lives with her youngest daughter. Her two older children are adults who have immigrated to the United States in search of better opportunities. She lives in her home where she also has her business.

María has a store selling food products, snacks, and other necessity items. She has had her business for more than 13 years. Thanks to her store, she has been able to get ahead and watch over her daughter, who graduated from high school, as she studied. Her store is her main source of income.

She needs this loan to stock her store with more products like sugar, coffee, oil, and other items that she needs to offer to her customers so she can sell more and therefore earn more profits.

María dreams of continuing to work at her store and of getting to see her children again. She also hopes to see her daughter attend university.

loans.use: to stock her store with more products like sugar, coffee, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
A positive outlook on life sustains Carmelita in her personal and family life, including management of her small general store. Despite stiff competition in this line of business, she continues to find ways to make her store more competitive. She organizes her merchandise and has added charcoal and rice to her inventory. Her income supplements the salary of her husband, Ponciano, a mason, and supports their everyday expenditures and their children’s education.

As much as Carmelita wants to sell more quantities of charcoal and rice, she has limited capital for it. She seeks your kindness to lend her PHP 29,000 additional capital which she can use to buy sacks of rice and charcoal, plus grocery items and beverages. Her profit and savings from these will pave the way towards her dream of completing her children’s education. She believes that education is a valuable wealth that cannot be stolen from her children.

She constantly prays for good health, peace and happiness for her family. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, charcoal, grocery items and beverages

loans.name: Jeremias Josue

texts.es:
Jeremías, de 25 años de edad, es un joven trabajador y lleno de entusiasmo, está casado y ya tienen un bebé con su esposa y ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar de su hijo. 

Jeremías, se dedica a la venta de teléfonos móviles, cargadores y otros accesorios de teléfonos; el tiene cerca de tres años de dedicarse a eso negocio, dice que gracias a su trabajo pudo casarse y salir adelante con su esposa. 

Jeremías, necesita el préstamo para comprar teléfonos móviles, cargadores y otros accesorios, porque necesita renovar y actualizar su inventario de aparatos electrónicos, para vender y tener más ganancias de su negocio. 

Los sueños de Jeremias, es poder trabajar y asegurar el futuro de su hijo, el quiere salir adelante y asi poder tener una mejor vida y que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Jeremías, 25, is a hardworking and enthusiastic young man. He is married, and he and his wife have a baby. His wife works as a homemaker and cares for their child.

Jeremías works selling cell phones, chargers, and other telephone accessories. He has had this business for nearly three years. He says that thanks to his work, he was able to get married and provide for his wife.

Jeremías needs this loan to buy cell phones, chargers, and other accessories, because he needs to update and refresh his inventory of electronic devices in order to sell and have more profits from his business.

Jeremias dreams of being able to work and secure his son's future. He wants to get ahead and have a better life, and he wants his business to prosper.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, chargers, and other accessories.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María, de 44 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su sobrina en el municipio del Progreso, Yoro. Ella cuenta con su propio negocio de venta de granos básicos, refrescos, embutidos, frijoles, harina, manteca y más. El cual funciona desde hace 6 años en su casa. Ha obtenido varios préstamos con la institución y actualmente solicita otro por la cantidad de 16,000.00 Lempiras para invertirlos en la compra de refrescos, maseca, harina, lácteos, embutidos y otros para poder aumentar sus ingresos brindándoles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su plan es  ampliar el negocio y ahorrar para mejorar su vivienda con el fin de vivir mejor.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old, single, and lives with her niece in the town of Progreso, Yoro. She owns a business selling basic grains, drinks, lunch meats, beans, flour, butter, and other items. She has run the business from her home for six years.

She has received various loans from the institution and is currently requesting another for 16,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of drinks, corn flour, flour, dairy products, lunch meats, and other items to increase her income by providing better service to her customers. Her plan is to expand her business and save to make improvements to her home so she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, corn flour, flour, dairy products, lunch meats, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes con 65 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge,en casa propia, en el distrito de Nueva Arica, provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

María Mercedes se dedica a las actividad de crianza y venta de cerdos, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y comida para estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mayor número de ventas de animales.

María Mercedes es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido 10 créditos anteriores los cuáles a cancelado de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en socio de nosotros su negocio a mejorado y su calidad de vida de igual forma.
texts.en:
María Mercedes, 65, is in a domestic partnership. She lives with her spouse in their own house in a rural area of the Nueva Arica district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, Perú. Residents of this area work primarily in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

María Mercedes works raising and selling pigs, with over ten years of experience in the business. Her business is located at her residence. She is requesting this loan in order to buy animals and animal feed. This investment will allow her to increase her numbers of animal sales.

María Mercedes is a repeat client of Edpyme Alternativa. She has had ten previous loans, which she repaid on time. Since she became a member, her business has improved, and so has her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Harisu

texts.en:
Harisu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Harisu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Harisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Harisu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Harisu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Harisu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Rey Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL EL SEÑOR ES MI REY ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES SEIS MUJERES Y DOS HOMBRES, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES CON DIES HIJOS, MENORES DE EDAD, ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER UNA ZONA PRODUCTORA DE LECHE, QUESO, CREMA, CUAJADA, ESTAS PERSONAS SON TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SALIR ADELANTE CON SUS DIFERENTES NEGOCIOS, HACER CRECER DIA A DIA EL NEGOCIO, SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS, Y BRINDARLES LA ESTABILIDAD QUE NECESITAN, Y QUE ELLOS NO PUDIERON TENER POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES  HEYDI Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE CERDOS EN PIE, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, Y POR ENCARGO A CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES. EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CERDOS, PARA QUE EN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS.EL SEÑOR ES MI REY AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Señor es mi Rey is made up of eight members, six women and two men. They are responsible mothers and fathers with ten young children. They are from Sauce, a place known as a production zone of milk, cheese, cream and curd. These borrowers are hard working and responsible, with goals to succeed. They currently fight to get ahead with their different businesses; make them grow day by day; and move their children forward and provide them the stability they need, which the borrowers themselves didn't have due to a lack of economic resources.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Heydi. As her job she raises and sells pigs. The business is located at her house, and she has both regular and occasional customers. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business buying and selling pigs, so that in the not too distant future she can obtain greater income. The El Señor es mi Rey group is thankful for the support of the Kiva lenders who loan to persons of limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, so they can have a dignified manner in which to work.

loans.use: to raise and sell pigs.

loans.name: Bahari Group

texts.en:
Consolatha, who is in her late 40's, is married with five kids. Two of her kids are in school and others are grown up. She has been selling fish for two years now. She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Consolatha's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her fish stock, and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for its support. She used the previous loans to repay a loan, to pay school fees, to take care of her family, to reinvest in her business, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her stock of fish, and to buy cooking oil and charcoal for frying fish. She dreams of expanding her business.

Consolatha will share this loan with her loan group, "Bahari,"which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish and to buy cooking oil and charcoal for frying fish.

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en:
Fruits and vegetables grow well in the region of Mindanao in the Philippines because it has fertile land and favorable weather conducive for farming. Typhoons seldom visit the area.

Zosimo, 51, is selling fruits near a public market in Santa Cruz, Davao Del Sur. As of now he offers bananas and some durian and soursop. He also sells used clothes to add profit. His income somehow provides for the basic needs of his family. But he knows that he can earn a higher profit if he has a permanent space inside the market. His current stall along the street is just temporary and unstable. If he will be given supplementary capital of PHP 20,000 he’s positive that he can work on the improvement of his business. He will buy more fruits such as durian, mangoes and pineapples, plus additional used clothes to sell. He implores your kind support to make these things possible.

Zosimo is married to Myrna who helps him in his business. They work together towards the goal to uplift their lives and complete their children’s education.

He is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and he regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits such as durian, mangoes and pineapples, plus additional used clothes to sell.

loans.name: El Progreso De San Juan Masias Group

texts.es: Juana es un mujer luchadora madre de tres hijos mayores de 36,34,y de 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta en su bodega dieciséis horas diarias desde hace cinco años,sus principales clientes son personas cercanas y vecinos de la zona, atiende aproximadamente de veinte a treinta personas diarias, el préstamo que solicitó  lo invertirá en la compra de víveres helados bebidas y demás para ampliar su bodega y así brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes.Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado y dice muchas gracias y sigan ayudando a gente que como yo lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Juana is a a determined woman, and a mother of three older children ages 36, 34, and 28 years old. She has worked sixteen hours per day selling in her grocery store for five years now. Her main customers are neighbors and close people in the area. She tends to about twenty or thirty people each day.

She will use the loan she has requested to buy foodstuffs, ice creams, drinks, and other items to expand her grocery store and thus provide better service to her customers. She is thankful to the Kiva lenders for their support and she says, "Thank you, and keep supporting people that need it, like me."

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, ice creams, drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is a 62-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in a small village called Chinti. The family lives in poverty as they have no source of stable income. Natela and her husband have a small agricultural activity: they take care of several chickens and pigs, which are sold at the local market.

Natela wants to expand her agribusiness and tackle their financial difficulties. Natela requested a loan from local financial institutions several times without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Natela plans to purchase a milk-cow with the requested amount and start dairy farming. She will start production of milk products and will sell them in the open market of the nearby town. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase greatly. Natela and her husband will be able to create better living conditions for themselves.

loans.use: to purchase a milk-cow and start dairy farming.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, es una madre soltera de 44 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos con los que vive en una de las aldeas de Florida, Copan, zona ceracna de Nueva Frontera. Doña Juana siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva aproximadamente 28 años de cultivar café lo que les permite ofrecer una variedad más amplia de producción, ofrece café en uva, húmedo, seco, pergamino y lo vende según la demanda con sus clientes. Por lo cual ella solicita la cantidad de 15,000.00 Lempiras para poder invertirlos en su finca, comprará fertilizantes para su aplicación y limpieza de la misma, para aumentar su producción y mejorar la calidad. Ella planea obtener más ingresos debido a que su cosecha mejorará al darle ese mantenimiento y de esa forma sacar adelante a su familia y seguir mejorando la producción y ventas.
texts.en: Juana is a 44 year old single mother. She has three children with whom she lives in one of the villages of Florida, Copan, an area close to Nueva Frontera. Juana has always worked in farming. She has spent approximately 28 years cultivating coffee, which allows her to offer a more ample variety of production. She offers coffee berries, wet processed coffee, dry processed coffee, parchment, and she sells it according to her customers' demands. For this, she is requesting the amount of 15,000.00 Lempiras to invest in her farm.
