She will buy fertilizers to use and do cleaning to her farm in order to increase her production and improve the quality. She plans to get more income, because her harvest will improve when getting maintenance. In this way, she will be able to move her family ahead and continue improving production and sales.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and do cleaning, in order to give maintenance to her coffee farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is married with children. His main business is CD burning and selling. He also sells charcoal and owns rentals. John would love to build himself a residential house, but still lacks the money to kick it off. He is requesting money to buy cement and timber for construction.

loans.use: to buy cement and timber for construction.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a maize farmer from Makaranta Kinkiba village. As a Babban Gona member, Aminu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Aminu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37 percent higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Aminu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/hecatre, Aminu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a maize farmer from Makaranta Kinkiba village. As a member of Babban Gona, Salisu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Salisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Salisu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Salisu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end he hopes to use his increased earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Sani

texts.en:
Alhaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Alhaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Alhaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/hectare. Alhaji is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Musa

texts.en:
Alhaji Musa is maize farmer from Maibindiga village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alhaji Musa is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Musa would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Musa can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alhaji Musa is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family he hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to eliminate pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bature

texts.en:
Bature is a maize farmer from Maibindiga village. As a Babban Gona member, Bature is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bature would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Bature will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Bature no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/hectare, Bature hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to eliminate pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is a maize farmer from Liman Damari village. As a Babban Gona member, Bashir is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bashir would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Bashir will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Bashir no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/hectare, Bashir hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to eliminate pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis Janvier 2004,  ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Maimouna,(assise avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des tissus d'un montant de 250000f payer un transport de 35000f aller et retour pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte s’occuper de ses enfants en augmentant leurs conditions de vie nourriture, dépense journalières et soins médicaux.
texts.en:
This group, created in January 2004, is composed of women who already have experience with the loan program. They mainly work as vendors.
Mrs. Maimouna (seated raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is a widow and has two daughters. She sells fabric. 

With this new loan, Maimouna plans to buy fabric for 250,000 West African francs and to pay roundtrip transportation costs in order to retail fabric in her neighborhood. Thanks to her loan, she plans to   improve her children's life conditions, providing for food, everyday expenses and healthcare costs.

loans.use: to buy fabric for retail and pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Very soon, Jeanette will be harvesting the matured rice, but it is still problematic about her rice thresher. Her old thresher has deteriorated so much due to long use. She aims to buy new spare parts that will make it function more efficiently. A thresher is very important equipment, especially during emergency harvest. It speeds up the harvesting process and cuts down the labor cost.

This is the reason why she is knocking at your generous hearts to lend her PHP 29,000, partly to buy thresher spare parts and partly to buy piglets for her hog-fattening business. Jeanette also raises hogs at the back of her house to augment her family’s resources.

Later on, she plans to buy transplanting equipment for her rice field if her savings suffice. She will also raise chickens, aside from hogs. All of these efforts are geared towards the completion of her children’s studies and a more comfortable life for her family someday. Rey, her husband, shares all her dreams and sacrifices. They live in Davao Del Sur in Mindanao region.

Jeanette faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the thresher, and partly to buy piglets.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 24 años de edad, vive al lado de su madre, su hermano y demás familiares. Tiene 5 años de residir en vivienda propia. Manuel se dedica a laborar como jornalero lo que le permite obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios y de esta manera ayudar con la economía del hogar. La vivienda de Manuel es humilde y su cuarto ha sido construido con láminas, las cuales no se encuentran en buen estado y se le hace difícil para los días de lluvia porque se filtra el agua y peligra a que por la humedad pueda enfermar. Y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, hierro, y pago de mano de obra para construir un cuarto habitación de materiales nuevos y de mejor calidad. De esta manera mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, 24 years old, lives with his mother, brother, and other relatives. He has been living in his own house for five years. Manuel works as a laborer, which allows him to earn the needed income, and therefore help with his household expenses.

Manuel's home is humble. His room was built with corrugated metal sheets, which are in poor shape. There are difficulties during rainy days, because water seeps in, and the moisture creates a danger of sickness. 

It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan from FUSAI (Kiva's field partner) to invest in: sand, cement, rebar, and labor costs to build a room with new materials and better quality. This way, he can improve his living condition.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, rebar, and labor costs to build a room with new materials and better quality.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a Babban Gona farmer. Yakubu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, Yakubu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yakubu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Yakubu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to repair his house or move into a bigger home and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Vakhtangi

texts.en:
Vakhtangi, 58 years old, is from the village of Geguti. He lives with son, daughter-in-law and little granddaughter. Vakhtangi is busy with a small-scale agricultural business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the monthly income from their agricultural business. They have a greenhouse and a plot of land. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category.

Vakhtangi's loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Vakhtangi plans to purchase a mini-bus and start serving local people on a bus line. He will get a significant source of income and make better living conditions for his family members.

Vakhtangi awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus and start working on a bus line.

loans.name: Sabitu

texts.en:
Sabitu is a maize farmer from Damari village. As a Babban Gona member, Sabitu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sabitu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Sabitu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at up to 37% more than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Sabitu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Sabitu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Azimbubu

texts.ru: Азимбубу, 44 года, замужем, образование- среднее, воспитывает 3 детей. Азимбубу с 2010 года занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 6 коров, 50 овец. Также занимается садом и огородом, выращивая овощи и фрукты для собственного потребления. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства Азимбубу составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Azimbubu is 44 years old, married, and raising three children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture since 2010.  She currently has six cows and 50 sheep on her farm.  She also has a garden and an orchard and she grows fruits and vegetables for the family's own consumption.  Thanks to her farming activity, she makes a monthly income of about 13,000 som (KGS).  

Eager to further grow her business, Azimbubu has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum bank, and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her farming business.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Sandra Yamileth

texts.es:
Sandra, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene tres hijas, una estudia segundo año bachillerato general, la otra noveno grado y la última estudia segundo grado.

Sandra, se ha dedicado a los oficios del hogar y también se dedica hacer antojitos y los vende en el cafetín que tiene su hermana en la escuela de la comunidad, asimismo su pareja siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en el terreno que está a 20 minutos de su vivienda y su pareja se traslada en bicicleta.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono y fertilizante y para ensementar el piso que está en la entrada principal de su casa, porque cuando llueve fuerte se encharca y se moja.

Ella, espera que la milpa dé una buena cosecha y espera además seguir vendiendo sus antojitos, porque ambas cosas son sus fuentes de ingresos, para pagar los gastos del hogar y asimismo darle los estudios a sus hijas para que terminen su carrera.
texts.en:
Sandra is 35 years old and studied until the eighth grade. She lives with her partner, who earns a living in agriculture. She has three daughters, one studies in the second year of her general bachelor's degree, another in the ninth grade, and the last studies in the second grade.

Sandra has earned a living in household services and also in making snacks and selling them in her sister's small café in the community's school. Additionally, her partner sows 7,000 square meters of corn in the plot that is 20 minutes from her house. Her partner travels there by bicycle.

She needs the loan in order to buy agricultural supplies such as compost and fertilizer and to cement the floor in the main entrance of her house, which floods and gets soaked when it rains intensely.

She hopes that the cornfield gives a good harvest. In addition, she hopes to continue selling her snacks. Both things are her sources of income in order to pay her household expenses and also to give her daughters an education so that they may complete their degrees.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as compost and fertilizers and to cement the floor in the main entrance of her house.

loans.name: Bubaisha

texts.ru: Бубайша  успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Бубайши на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров, 12 овец. На собственном участке, мерою 2,04 ГА, она выращивает арбузы и дыни для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 24,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бубайша вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 телят для разведения. Доходы от кредита помогут Бубайше развить ее бизнес и накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Bubaisha successfully repaid her loan, after using it for its intended purpose.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her obtain this financing.  Bubaisha now has five cows and 12 sheep on her farm.  She also grows watermelons and cantaloupes for resale on her own 2.4 hectares of land.  Her monthly income comes to 24,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, Bubaisha is once more turning to Bai Tushum.  This time, she is taking a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy three calves for breeding.  The earnings from her loan will allow her to grow her business and to save enough money to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase three calves in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et et il est composé de femmes issues du même village et unies par de bonnes relations de voisinages.
Madame Astou est la présidente elle est âgée de 44 ans mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 garçons et deux filles tous scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de brebis . Avec son nouveau crédit de 300 000 francs CFA elle va se payer des brebis qu'elle va engraisser puis revendre au niveau des marchés de sa localités.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins sanitaires de son mari malade et de payer la scolarité et des fournitures scolaires a ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group, created during the first cycle of the Banc Villageois, consists of women who all come from the same village and who enjoy friendly neighbourly relations.

Astou is the group's representative.  She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of five children (three boys and two girls) who all go to school.  Astou buys and sells ewes.  She will use her new loan of 300,000 CFA francs to buy a few ewes for fattening and resale at the local markets.

Astou has a great deal of experience in her field of work because she's been involved in this activity for a long time.  Thanks to her profits, she is able to cover the costs associated with her husband's medical treatment (as he is currently ill), and she also pays her children's school fees and school supplies.

loans.use: to buy a few ewes to fatten up and resell.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana solicita un préstamo de millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000), dinero que usará para la compra de materiales de construcción necesarios para realizar las reparaciones en su vivienda. De esta forma podrá asegurar su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Roxana is requesting a loan of one million fifty thousand Colones (local currency, ₡ 1 050 000), which will used to purchase construction materials needed to make repairs to her home. This way, she can make her home secure and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Santos Agustin

texts.es:
Santos con 58 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Santos cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Santos se dedica al servicio de construcción en Cayaltí y anexos, cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en el rubro. Se solicita préstamo para pago de alquiler de maquinaria y compra de accesorios para herramientas. De esta manera seguirá atendiendo la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar, ampliará su cartera de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales para su familia.

Santos con experiencia crediticia pagando 02 créditos puntualmente.
texts.en:
Santos is 58 years old, and in a common-law marriage. He lives with his spouse, in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in the country of Perú. Santos has very good references, both personal and professional, through the residents of the area.

The people in this town mostly work in agriculture, business, and with livestock. Santos works in construction in and around Cayaltí. He has been working in this field for more than 20 years. He is asking for a loan to pay for equipment rental, and to purchase accessories for tools. This way, he can continue to attend to the unmet demand in his area. He will also expand his customer base, finding new customers and additional income for his family.

Santo has experience with receiving loans, and has repaid 2 loans on time.

loans.use: to pay to rent machinery and to purchase accessories for tools.

loans.name: Mamuda

texts.en:
Mamuda is a maize farmer from Damari village. As a Babban Gona member, Mamuda is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mamuda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Mamuda will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mamuda no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Mamuda hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Dauda

texts.en:
Alhaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Alhaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Alhaji is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdulrashid

texts.en:
Abdulrashid is maize farmer from Damari village. As a member of Babban Gona, Abdulrashid is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulrashid would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulrashid can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Abdulrashid is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eriphazi

texts.en:
Eriphazi is married with children. He does welding as his only source of income. He is faced with a challenge of competition, but somehow he manages because of his hard work, honesty, and doing quality work.

At the moment, Erifaz has some door contracts, but the available materials are not enough. He requests money to buy more welding materials.

loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Davao City is the fourth largest city in the Philippines in terms of population. Many schools, offices, workplaces, and various establishments flourish in the city, as well as different businesses. Boarding houses, rooms-for-rent, and apartments are in demand because many students and workers come from other towns or provinces.

This is the reason why Leonora, 43 years old, decided to invest in rooms-for-rent. Here is where she put her husband’s hard-earned money from abroad. Her husband, Victorino, had to leave her and their children to seek a more decent wage abroad. He’s been away from them for several years already. It’s difficult for Leonora to accompany and guide their growing up children alone, but she keeps on. She has to endure the situation and pursue the completion of her children’s studies so as to pay off the sacrifices of her husband abroad.

Besides these rooms-for-rent, she also invested in a rice field to contribute to food production in her community. Now she has to buy palay, rice seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides and she needs PHP 20,000 supplementary capital because a large chunk of her cash was already consumed for the rooms and rice field. Hopefully her investments will give her family enough resources someday so that her husband need not work abroad anymore.

Leonora faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy palay, rice seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Muntari

texts.en:
Muntari is a maize farmer from Damari village. As a Babban Gona member, Muntari is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Muntari would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Muntari will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Muntari no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Muntari hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said, who is in his late 30s, is married with three children; one of them is grown up, while the others are still in school. He has been selling charcoal for three years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Said's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his charcoal stock and has paid back his loan successfully. He is happy with the loan. He received some extra income that he used to buy a plot of land, to repay the loan, to pay school fees, to reinvest in the business and to cover household expenses.

Said will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. He dreams of expanding his business.

Said will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is maize farmer from Damari village. As a member of Babban Gona, Rabiu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabiu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Rabiu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

Magaji is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.name: Daniel De Jesús

texts.es:
Daniel, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen 5 hijos, pero solo 4 viven con ellos, por el momento ninguno estudia y todos trabajan en la agricultura y en los oficios domésticos, nadie más vive con ellos. 

Daniel, desde muy joven es albañil y aprendió este negocio porque antes trabajaba de ayudante con otros señores y además se dedica a la agricultura y siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados, en un terreno que está a unas cuadras de su vivienda y le ayudan sus hijos con las labores agrícolas. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas y para comprar fertilizantes y abono y otra parte del préstamo para comprar de especies menores, especialmente cerditos. 

Sus sueños son para su familia es que estén unidos y que tenga buena salud y espera que le vaya bien con la siembra para tener buenas ganancias y pagar todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Daniel, 47 years old, studied until the seventh grade. He is married and his wife tends to the household chores. They have 5 children but only 4 live with them. At the moment, none of them are in school and all of them work in agriculture and on the household chores. Nobody else lives with them.

Daniel has been a mason since a very young age. He learned this business by previously working as a helper to other men. He also works in agriculture and plants on 7,000 square meters, on a plot that is a few blocks away from his home. His children help him with the farming work.

He needs the loan to buy farming supplies, manure and fertilizers and the other part of the loan is to buy small animals, specifically piglets.

His dream is for his family to be together and healthy. He hopes the harvest goes well for them in order to have a good income and to pay all of the household costs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, manure and fertilizers and the other part of the loan is to buy small animals, specifically piglets.

loans.name: Nguli Group

texts.en:
Rufina, who is in her late 30's is married with three schooling children. She has been running two projects: selling fried fish, and making and selling bites for seven years now. She works from 5 am to  8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Rufina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to make and sell bites and to increase on fish stock. She dreams of extending her business.

Rufina will share this loan with her loan group Nguli Group, which consists of nine members. Each hold one another accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to make and sell bites and to increase her fish stock.

loans.name: Visezi Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is in her late 30's and is married with six children. One is grown up while the others are still at school. She has been selling goats for six years now. She works from 8 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business and has managed to repay all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees for her five kids to repay a loan and covered household expenses. Fatuma will use this loan to increase her stock of goats and meet her customers' demand. Fatuma dreams is to be a big business woman.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group Visezi, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goats and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Yunusa

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Luisa Del Rosario

texts.en:
Luisa is a single mother. She has a place where she cooks and she serves local and seasonal foods. She is hardworking, committed and above all responsible. 

She is currently living in her parents´ place but she has the goal of building a room to live with her daughter, and gradually build a home to leave an heritage to her daughter. She has learned that with perseverance and effort, along with determination, she can accomplish what she proposes to herself. 

She is asking for a credit to make this dream come true.

loans.use: To build a room to live with her daughter and leave parents place

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.en:
Maria is a single mother since her 3 years old son was born. She is currently working on a clothes factory but she has always had an entrepreneur spirit. She is currently selling shoes for women and girls. She needs the microcredit because she wants to finish building her house and this way having a neat and worthy home for her only child. 

She thinks that key attributes to accomplish her dreams are determination and effort. She has always wanted to give her son a better place than the one she grew in.

loans.use: To build a worthy house for her only child

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is a single mother of a 5 years old girl; with dedication and effort she was able to raise her family without the help of her husband. She is employed by a company that provides group loans and has been working there for 6 years.
As a responsible and hardworking individual, she has instructed her daughter the value of commitment and hard work, as well as building blocks to success.
One of her greatest wishes in life is to have a home for herself and her daughter, that is why she is requesting a loan to buy materials to finish her house. This way she will also be able to provide an heritage for her daughter.

loans.use: To pay for materials to build a decent housing for her and her 5 year old daughter.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a single mother of a disabled child. She lives with her in Calkini municipality in Campeche Mexico. She sells snacks and hammocks for living.

She is currently requesting a credit with SGS to build a roof over her house and improve their current life quality. This way she will be able to secure a decent home for her child.

loans.use: To build a roof on her house and improve her daughter´s life quality.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “LAS MARGARITAS” conformada por 06 socios con deseos de trabajar y mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella es MARITZA una de las socias de 39 años de edad casada con 2 hijos dependientes. Ella tiene su negocio de confección de prendas de vestir desde hace 7 años tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos profesionales. Solicito el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos. El grupo “las margaritas” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir creciendo. Maritza es la segunda del lado derecho lleva en brazos a su hijo y  viste polo color rojo.
texts.en:
The group 'Las Margaritas' is made up of six members. They all want to work to improve their quality of life.

Maritza, 39, is married with two young children. She has been in business making clothes for seven years.

Her main aim is to raise her children so that they become professionals in the future.

She is asking for a loan to buy thread and cloth.

The group are very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they give them. It allows them to keep growing.

Maritza is the second on the right. She is holding her son in her arms and is wearing a red t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y eligió estudiar la carrera de Educación Inicial ya que le gusta mucho los niños,  trabaja en un centro educativo como auxiliar, con ese trabajo ella puede cubrir algunos gastos como materiales que les piden en la universidad. El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago de las mensualidades del quinto ciclo y así poder estudiar tranquilamente sin la preocupación de falta de pago de las mensualidades. Yeny desea terminar como doctorado en administración  educativa y así formar su propio centro educativo. Yeny se siente contenta de la ayuda que recibe de los inversionistas Kiva por que gracias a ellos va a poder culminar sus estudios satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Yeny, 22, is single and chose to study primary school education because she likes children a lot. She works as a teaching assistant in a school, which allows her to pay for some of the material she needs for university.

She will use the loan to pay the monthly course fees of her fifth cycle, so she can study without worrying about not being able to pay for her education.

She would like to finish with a doctorate in educational administration, so she can set up her own learning centre.

She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they offer. She will now be able to finish her studies and fulfil her dream.

loans.use: to pay monthly university course fees.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Doña Marcelina solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000), para la compra de gallinas ponedoras, esto con el propósito de aumentar el número de animales y utilizar el espacio disponible para el desarrollo de dicha actividad. De esta forma logrará incrementar los ingresos que generará dicho negocio.
texts.en:
Marcelina is asking for a loan of 1,050,000 Costa Rican colones to buy laying hens. She hopes to increase the number of animals she looks after, making the most of the space available to her.

This will allow her to generate more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy laying hens.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel con 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia ,junto a su cónyuge e hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Miguel Ángel cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Miguel Ángel se dedica a la acrianza y venta de animales menores, desde hace más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro.Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, con esto Miguel Ángel espera tener mejores condiciones de vida para él y su familia.

Miguel Ángel cuenta con experiencia crediticia en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel, 28, lives with his partner and their son in their own home in Cayalti, Chiclayo, Peru. This region falls under the Lambayeque department.

He has a good reputation, both as a person and as a professional, with the people of his area. Most of the people in this small town work in either agriculture, commerce or livestock.

Miguel Angel raises and sells small animals. He has been doing this for more than five years.

He is asking for a loan to have some money to invest in his business. He hopes that this will help him provide a better quality life for his family.

This is his second loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in his business.

loans.name: Jonathan Erick

texts.es: Jonathan tiene 24 años de edad, está soltero y trabaja como asistente contable en una empresa privada, ya que gracias al apoyo que viene recibiendo de KIVA pudo terminar satisfactoriamente sus estudios. Hace 2 meses empezó con su nuevo objetivo que es terminar un diplomado en tributación en una universidad nacional para así poder trabajar como contador en una empresa muy importante, es por ello que el nuevo préstamo que solicito lo invertirá en sus estudios como comprar una laptop que necesita para realizar sus trabajos y así facilitarle sus actividades diarias. Jonathan está muy contento y agradecido con los inversionistas de KIVA por la nueva oportunidad que se le brinda  para cumplir otro de sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Jonathan, 24, is single and works as an accounting assistant in a private enterprise. He is able to do this thanks to the kiva loan system, which allowed him to pay for the completion of his studies.

Two months ago he started work on a new goal: studying for a diploma in tax management at the national university. This will help him find work as an accountant in an important company.

So now he is asking for a new loan for his studies. He will invest in things such as buying a laptop, something he needs to carry out his daily work more efficiently.

He is very satisfied and grateful for the opportunities he has received thanks to the Kiva loan system. This is helping him to fulfil his dreams.

loans.use: to buy materials for his work and studies such as a laptop.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis es un joven de 27años de edad, soltero con ganas de salir adelante. Estudia la carrera de Derecho hace  cuatro años  le gusta mucho esta carrera por que va de la mano con la política, trabaja en una moto-taxi en sus ratos libres, el dinero que recibió como préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de materiales que le piden en la universidad. Cuando termine sus estudios piensa en trabajar en un estudio jurídico y así tener la tranquilidad y estabilidad que se propone, Agradece mucho  a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo  que brinda a los estudiante que como el desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is a young man of 27 years. He is single and eager to get ahead. He has been studying for a law degree for four years. He really likes this degree because it goes hand in hand with politics.

In his free time he works for a motorcycle-taxi. He will use the money received from the loan to buy the supplies requested at his university. He is thinking of working at a law firm when he finishes studying that way he can have the calm and stability that is intended. He is very thankful for the Kiva investors for the support they provide to students, like him, who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay the costs of supplies for university.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn  is a 44-year-old married  woman who lives in the rural areas of Clarin, Bohol. She raises and sells hogs. She has six children. Five of her children are still attending school  ages 4- 20 years old respectively. For almost two years now she has been raising and selling hogs to the locals in her place.
Her husband earns an income by being a driver.

She would like to improve her income.
Evelyn  needs a loan to buy feed.  With these, she could able to sold quality hogs. These will help augment her income. Thus, she could continue provide the needs of her children. 

For the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her livelihood  by increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal is 50, married and has 4 sons and one daughter; 2 of his children are married in separate houses. He has a small fattening project and is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his sales of milk, cheese and butter and sell the calves.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle for increased milk sales.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester is a married man. He has 10 children. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a densely populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high production costs. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. He hopes that in the future, he will buy more sewing machines. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with 8 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes, maize and other crops. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy seeds to plant. Her business goal is to expand her farm within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy water pipes to enable her irrigate her farm. She hopes that in the future, have a large scale business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy water pipes

loans.name: Upile

texts.en:
Upile is 21 years old. She is the first born in a family of three. She lives with her parents and has always wanted to run her own business. Upile just finished training with Zoona so that she can start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Dowa, Malawi. Upile completed her high school education in 2013 but did not go to college due to lack of sponsorship. Her parents do not have enough money to keep all three of them in school so Upile had to give way to her younger siblings so that they too can at least have a high school certificate.

Upile says her life will change once she starts running her own business because she will be able to provide for her basic needs and help out her parents by buying groceries and paying for bills.
Upile needs a Kiva loan in order to start running her Zoona mobile money transfer business. The loan will be used to provide essential funds needed for her to serve her customers who need to access financial services. She will also use the loan to purchase a trading trolley, and a mobile phone and have the funds needed to serve customers. These items are necessary for her to start her business.

Upile has big dreams for the future. Her dream is to run a successful business and diversify by opening a restaurant so that she can get to a point where she pays for her siblings’ college tuition.

loans.use: to provide essential funds needed for her to serve her customers who need to access financial service and procure a web-enabled phone and a trading trolley

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Jolly has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Jolly would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Jolly can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Jolly will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Jolly is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields.

loans.name: Katherine Zuley

texts.es: Katherine tiene 22 años de edad, esta soltera y con muchos deseos de triunfar en la vida. En unos meses culminara su carrera técnica profesional de secretariado en un instituto particular, gracias a ello podrá trabajar responsablemente en diferentes empresas que requieren su servicio. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en comprar una Laptop que necesita para poder realizar sus trabajos del instituto que tiene. Uno de sus anhelos es estudiar la carrera de administración para poder implementar su propia empresa de regalos y detalles para enamorados, novios y esposos, ya que su idea es muy novedosa y aceptado por el público. Ella se siente muy contenta y agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando.
texts.en: Katherine is 22 years old, single, and with a great desire to triumph in live. In a few months, she will finish her technical professional secretarial studies degree at a private school. Thanks to this, she will be able to work responsibly in different businesses that need her service. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of a laptop that she needs to be able to do the coursework that she has. One of her desires is to study for an administration degree to be able to open her own business of gifts and decorations for people who are dating, engaged and married, since her idea is very current and accepted by the public. She is very happy and grateful to the Kiva investors for the support and confidence that they are offering.

loans.use: to purchase study equipment like a laptop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace mas de 2 años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de lociones, jabones, shampoo, etc. todo por mayor para surtir su negocio ya que le ha ido bien en las ventas y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, has worked selling personal care products for over 2 years and with the earnings that she gets, she manages to get ahead. The young woman is a single mother and lives in her own house with her child. She is asking for another loan to purchase lotions, soaps, shampoo, etc., all in bulk, to stock her business since it has gone well in sales and in this way she will be able to have more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, soaps, shampoo, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Los Amigos De Pariachi Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “LOS AMIGOS DE PARIACHI” conformada por 06 socios emprendedores. Este es el caso VICTOR de 70 años de edad soltero. Víctor se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral. Desde hace más de 10 años que tiene dicho negocio gracias a su esfuerzo logro mejorar su calidad de vida. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de comida para sus animales como engorde maíz partido y alfalfa. El grupo “los amigos de parachí” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite mejorar su calidad de vida. Víctor es el segundo del lado izquierdo viste polo color blanco.
texts.en: This is the new group "Los Amigos de Pariachí," made up of 6 enterprising members. This is the case of Víctor, 70 years old and single. Víctor works raising farm animals. For over 10 years he has had this business and thanks to his efforts he managed to improve his quality of life. His greatest desire is to be able to expand his business. He asked for the loan to purchase feed for his animals such as chopped corn for fattening and alfalfa. The group "Los Amigos de Parachí" is grateful to the people of Kiva who made this loan possible, since it permits them to improve their quality of life. Víctor is the second on the left wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his animals such as chopped corn for fattening and alfalfa.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria con 47 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hija ,vive en casa propia,en el distrito de Morropón, provincia de Morropón,departamento de Piura, país Perú.los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Victoria se dedica a la crianza y venta de carne de credo,esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 4 años, en su domicilio y caseríos vecinos, ya que Victoria cuenta con clientela fija, la cuál le hace pedidos y entrega para la semana.Victoria cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con capacidad de pago. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de chanchos, para su negocio y compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.

Victoria es socia recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa,cancela puntual sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Victoria, 47, is in a common-law marriage. She lives in her own home with her husband and her youngest daughter in the Morropón district of the province of Morropón in the department of Piura, Peru. The residents of this town work primarily in farming and ranching.

Victoria earns a living raising and selling pig meat. She has done this job for more than four years at her home and in nearby communities. Victoria has steady customers who order from her, and she delivers weekly.

Victoria has experience in the business and the capacity to pay. She also sells groceries in her home.

She's requesting the loan to buy pigs for her business and merchandise for her grocery store.

Victoria is a return client for Edpyme Alternativa. She repays her debt punctually.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her business and merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya sells children's clothes at the market. She is an active and hardworking person.

Due to the previous loan, Natalya increased her income. She wants to develop her business further. Natalya hopes that local currency devaluation will not make a significant impact on her business.

Natalya is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to increase her assortment of winter clothes for children. The loan will help her to get new clients and increase her income.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of winter clothes for sale.

loans.name: Las Cocineras Group

texts.en:
The town of Chiantla is located in the state of Huehuetenango in the northwestern part of Guatemala, 168 miles from the capital. The people of the area speak Mam (Maya) and Spanish. Ten women came together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Cocineras” (The Cooks).

One of the group’s members is Hermitania, who is 32 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 13. Her business is buying and selling sheep, a small business that has been very profitable for her because of her many customers.

Hermitania is asking for a loan to buy a larger number of sheep that she can sell in the market besides those she sells from her home. Thanks to the income she is making from her sheep sales, Hermitania is able to support the education of three out of four of her children. This is a very important accomplishment for her, since she knows that having a good education will make her children’s futures more successful.

A good education also helps Hermitania and her friends in “Las Cocineras.” As members of the Trust Bank, they are able to take part in the monthly non-formal education sessions provided by a facilitator, who, after the women do their loan payments and accounting, presents a topic, such as good business management, leadership, or health. Friendship Bridge calls this winning combination of education and microfinance “Microcredit Plus.” To date, 22,000 Maya women have benefited from the program and have seen their lives change from ignorance through poverty, to brighter and more successful lives. Kiva investors who support this program have helped make their development possible. Mil gracias, Kiva!

loans.use: to buy a larger number of sheep that she can sell in the market.

loans.name: Nueva Florecita Group

texts.en:
Child brides under the legal age of 14 (with parental consent) are everywhere in Guatemala. Those who live in rural areas are the most vulnerable. Anastasia, a 49-year-old member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, located in the growing town of Los Encuentros, is an example. She married when she was 12 years old and has been married for 37 years. She was not able to attend school at all.

Anastasia has eight children and through hard work and dedication, has sent all to primary school. She has been with Friendship Bridge through five loan cycles and has realized increased growth of her tailoring business as well as increased income. Anastasia not only makes men’s clothing as well as the embroidery on traditional textiles, she also has a convenience store where she sells dishes made from her delicious recipes.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fabric and thread for her textile business as well as more inventory for her store. Anastasia really likes her businesses and wants to continue with them until she is 60 years old!

For women like Anastasia, who married so young and were unable to attend school, the educational component of the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, combining loans and education, is of vital importance. Through diagrams, role playing and games, a facilitator from the organization shares information with Anastasia and her friends about women’s rights, health, hygiene, as well as how their bodies function. They learn about empowerment and self-esteem, setting goals and realizing dreams. They also learn to manage their small businesses with new business tools like budgeting, pricing and accounting.

As the 11 women in this Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Nueva Florecita” live in Los Encuentros, a town where several roads converge, they have the opportunity to attract customers from throughout the area who are traveling mostly on converted brightly painted school buses from the United States. These transformed vehicles, called “chicken buses” or “camionetas” bring thousands of people through Los Encuentros on a daily basis. The ladies in the Trust Bank are aware of this and have various commercial ventures including convenience stores, shoe stores and stores selling kitchen goods. Others weave and embroider colorful traditional blouses called “huipiles” (wee-pee-les) that they sell in the town as well as in the huge markets in the nearby town of Chichicastenango, where the 11 members of the group are from. They are quite excited about their ties with Kiva and this is their third loan cycle.

Thank you, Kiva investors, for funding loans for ladies like Anastasia and her ten friends in the Trust Bank. They are poised to step into a brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community in Los Encuentros, Guatemala.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric and thread for her textile business as well as more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Los Siervos De Jesus Group

texts.es: Este es la alcancía comunal “Los Siervos de Jesús” creada hace algunos años por personas con espíritu de triunfo y que ahora lo conforman 6 mujeres muy responsables representada por su presidenta la Sra. Alejandra de 51 años de edad, madre soltera con 2 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Tiene el negocio de la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo adicionalmente ella trabaja vendiendo todo tipo de comidas dentro de un colegio por su zona, así de esta manera ella genera sus propios ingresos para poder cubrir con sus diferentes gastos diarios. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en comprar al por mayor diferentes productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas, maquillajes, etc y atender los pedidos que tiene por muchos de sus clientes. Ella se siente muy contenta y agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por el apoyo y confianza que en esta nueva etapa del grupo se le está brindando. En la foto grupal la Sra. Alejandra se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.
texts.en:
This is Los Siervos de Jesús Communal Bank, formed a few years ago by people of triumphant spirit and now made up of six very responsible women represented by their president, Alejandra.

Alejandra's 51 years old and the single mother of two children who are no longer dependent on her. She has a business making catalogue sales of beauty products. She also works selling all types of food in a school in her area. She earns her own income this way and she's able to cover her various daily expenses.

Alejandra is going to invest the loan in a wholesale purchase of various beauty products, including perfume, creams, and make-up, and tend to the orders she has from many of her customers.

She's very happy, and grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support and the trust being given to the group in this new stage.

In the group photo, Alejandra's standing in the middle of her seated colleagues.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as perfume, creams, and make-up

loans.name: Kalina

texts.en:
Kalina is married and has three sons. Together with her husband and youngest son, she lives in a private house.

Kalina has been working as a controller for nine years. She is hardworking and active person.

Kalina likes to work at her garden. She has a small greenhouse near her house.

Kalina is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to put paving stones in front of her house. The loan will help to make their courtyard more attractive.

loans.use: to put paving stones in front of the house.

loans.name: Elsa Iris

texts.es: Elsa, tiene 22 años de edad, esta casada y vive en el municipio de Santa Rita, Yoro junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Elsa trabajó en una maquila anteriormente y de sus ahorros mas la ayuda de su esposo quien realiza trabajos de albañileria pudo comprar una mototaxi para transporte de personas dentro de la comunidad.  este negocio lo tiene hace 1 año el que le genera ingresos para su familia. Ella solicita la cantidad de 21,000.00 Lempiras para poder darle mantenimiento y reparación del motor a su mototaxi y seguir trabajando y brindando un  mejor servicio a los clientes. Tiene como meta generar mas ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida económicamente dentro del núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Elsa, 22, is married and she lives with her husband and her two children in the town of Santa Rita, Yoro. Her husband works as a bricklayer.

Previously Elsa worked in a factory and, with her savings and her husband's help, she bought a motorcycle taxi to transport passengers in her community. She has had this business for a year and she earns an income for her family with it.

She's requesting 21,000 lempiras [HNL] to maintain and repair the motor of her motorcycle taxi so she can keep on working and providing better customer service.

Her goal is to earn more income to financially improve the quality of life in her immediate family.

loans.use: to maintain and repair the motor of her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Ayaga Yaro

texts.en:
Ayaga Yaro is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Ayaga Yaro has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land -- 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ayaga Yaro would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Ayaga Yaro can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ayaga Yaro will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Ayaga Yaro is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kinyamangi  United Traders Group

texts.en:
Francis a member of Kinyamangi United Traders, where members guarantee each other's loans. He is aged 36 and has four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He is a fish monger and at the same time a farmer, growing food crops like bananas, peas, tomatoes and onions. He started farming in 2007 with a hope of raising more income to pay school fees and develop himself. He is faced with challenges of low capital and seasonal changes, especially heavy rains that disturb his ability to fish.

Despite that, he has a vision of improving his standard of living. Francis has asked for a loan to buy fish nets to use in fishing.

loans.use: to buy fish nets to use in fishing.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is married. He deals in a chicks project, and he also earns salary for additional income. He is able to cater for his family needs using the proceeds and also provide basic needs for them.

His greatest desire is to educate his children to higher levels of learning. But now he lacks some money to complete his children's school fees ahead of the promotion term. He would be grateful for help with money to meet this need as he has no alternative.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es: Dalila es una mujer de 59 de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus dos hijos de 15 y 21 años de edad. Dalila se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, desde hace 5 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan de sus productos. Dalila desea invertir en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ya que cada día logra hacerse de más clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maquillaje, mascara para pestañas, lociones, desodorantes, entre otros productos para su negocio.
texts.en: Dalila is a 59 year old woman. She lives in her own home with her two children, aged 15 and 21.  Dalila has sold beauty products for 5 years. She has a large number of customers who seek her out for her products. Dalila wants to invest in her beauty products selling business, because every day she is able to gain more customers who ask for her products. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in makeup, mascara, lotions, deodorants and more products for her business.

loans.use: to invest in makeup, mascara, lotions, deodorants, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Dora Nelis

texts.es:
Dora, de 27 años de edad, no pudo estudiar debido a que sus padres no tenían la capacidad económica para que ella estudiara, está soltera, se acompañó pero tuvo problemas con su pareja y se separaron, con él tuvo 3 hijos que ahora tienen 11, 8 y 5 años de edad y aún no estudian, en su casa vive junto a sus padres y sus hijos.

Dora, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, porque al no poder estudiar ella tenía que trabajar para apoyar en los gastos de la casa, ella actualmente vende verduras y pescado, ella va a traer su mercadería hasta la ciudad y tiene que trasladarla hasta su comunidad, donde vende el producto casa por casa y lo carga dentro de guacales (recipientes) y para vender le ayuda su hijo mayor.

Dora, necesita el préstamo para comprar más verduras para incrementar su negocio, porque es una buena fuente de ingresos que ella ha encontrado y de la cual obtiene ingresos para darles a sus hijos lo necesario.

Dora, desea en corto tiempo poder tener un lugar donde vender sus productos en un puesto fijo, el cual será administrado por sus hijos mientras ella continua en la venta ambulante de pescado, todo para incrementar las ganancias y con ellas poder construir su propia casa, porque tiene un pequeño terreno que le han dado sus padres y en ese lugar construirá su casa para poder independizarse de sus padres.
texts.en:
Dora is 27 years old. She wasn't able to go to school because her parents didn't have the financial capacity for her to get an education. She is single. She used to be married, but she had problems with her spouse and they separated. She had 3 children with him and now they are 11, 8 and 5 and not in school yet. She lives in her house with her parents and children.

Dora has taken care of the home since she was a girl, because since she couldn't go to school she had to work to help with the household expenses. Now she sells vegetables and fish. She brings her merchandise to the city and has to transport it to her community where she sells the product door to door and she carries it in the containers to sell, Her oldest son helps her.

Dora needs the loan to buy more vegetables to grow her business, because it is a good source of income that she has found and from which she is able to give her children what they need.

In the short term, Dora wants to be able to have a set place to sell her products. This will be run by her children while she continues to sell the fish door to door. This is all to increase profits so that she can build her own house. She has a small plot of land that her parents gave her and there she will build a house so she can be independent from her parents.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to grow her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 33 year old, a mother of four children and caring for two dependents. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

She deals in buying and selling palm oil. She gets additional income from selling food locally and cocoa from her garden. She started the business 25 years ago to raise school fees for her children. She works hard and has plans of expanding the palm oil and cocoa businesses, but she lacks enough capital.

She wants to restock palm oil for selling, thus her decision to request a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy palm oil for the business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for selling.

loans.name: Zangi

texts.en:
Zangi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Zangi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Zangi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Zangi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Zangi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Zangi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Sule has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sule would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Sule can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Sule will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Sule is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kabir

texts.en:
Kabir is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Kabir has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabir would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Kabir can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Kabir will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Kabir is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro, tiene 59 años de edad, casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el municipio de Azacualpa, 
Santa Bárbara.  El se dedica a la venta de mercadería de ropa como ser: camisas, blusas, faldas y medicinas populares como panadol, acetaminofén, vitaminas, antiácidos,  anti diarreicos, etc. esta actividad ha sido su fuente de ingresos desde hace 10 años aproximadamente y lo realiza en forma ambulante. Esta solicitando el segundo prestamo en la institución que es por la cantidad de 20,000.00 Lempiras, con el fin de contar con mayor inventario y poder cubrir una zona más extensa y de esa forma aumentar su cantidad de ventas para que su negocio siga creciendo. Su plan es dejarles trabajo a sus hijos.
texts.en: Ramiro is 59 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their two children in the town of  Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  He sells clothing merchandise such as shirts, blouses, skirts, and popular medicines such as Panadol, acetaminophen, vitamins, antacids, anti- diarrheals, etc. This activity has been a source of income for approximately 10 years and he does it as a street vendor. He is asking for his second loan with the institution in the amount of 20,000.00 Lempiras. He is doing this to have more inventory and to cover a larger area and thus increase his sales so his business can keep growing.  His plan is to leave this work to his children.

loans.use: to stock his business with clothing merchandise and medicines to sell.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Samaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.
