Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Samaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Samaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Florinda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Florinda, de 43 años de edad, se caracteriza por trabajar de una forma tan ordenada y eficiente, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos, uno de ellos de 13 años y el otro de 16 años y la primera que se casó y viajo a E.E.U.U. y en su casa solo vive con su esposo, hijos y su nieto de 8 años de edad.

Florinda, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa usada desde hace 15 años, ella decidió colocar este negocio porque le genera buenos ingresos y es una forma de ayudar a las personas que no tienen los recursos para poder comprar ropa de marca y cara; su esposo también le ayuda para los gastos del hogar, porque el se dedica a vender minutas en la ciudad.

Florinda, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos fardos de pantalones y camisas para damas y caballeros y así tener suficiente mercadería para ofrecerles a sus cliente y que este le genere mejores ganancias para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

El sueño de Florinda, es tener un negocio más grande y que este le genere buenos ingresos para poder darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Florinda is 43 years old. She is characterized as working in a very ordered and efficient way. She went to school up to the seventh grade. She is married and the mother of 3 children. One of them is 13 and the other is 16. The third, the oldest, is already married and she moved to the U.S. and is married. She lives with her husband, children and her 8 year old grandson.

Florinda has bought and sold used clothing for 15 years. She decided to start this business because it generates good income and is a way to help people who don't have the resources to buy brand clothing that is expensive. Her husband also helps her with the household expenses, because he sells minutes in the city.

Florinda needs the loan to buy two packs of pants and shirts for women and men so that she will have enough merchandise to offer her customers. This will generate better profits to meet her family's needs.

Florinda's dream is to have a bigger business and for this to generate good income so she can give her children the opportunity to get and education.

loans.use: to buy two packs of pants and shirts for women and men.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is 23 years old. She is a single mother of two, an 8-year-old and a 5-year-old. Agatha has is requesting for a Kiva loan so that she can empower herself by starting to run her own business. This will insure that she is able to pay for her children’s school fees.
Agatha hopes to gain experience in the business world and learn about how to manage a business and help contribute to solving Malawi’s larger financial issues. Agatha has faced financial hardship with regards to providing for herself and her children. She explains that she had a children when she was still very young and without a husband to help out, it has been a challenge. She is very excited about the opportunity of having her own Zoona mobile money transfer business. She dreams of providing her children with a full education.

Agatha is requesting a loan in order to procure working capital to get her Zoona business started, so that she may one day achieve her hopes and dreams. The loan will be used to purchase a Zoona branded trolley and a web enabled mobile phone. The loan will also provide Agatha with the funds to serve her customers.
Agatha’s business will provide financial services and help people to send and receive money when they need to most.

loans.use: to procure working capital to get her Zoona business started, so that she can provide financial services and may one day achieve her hopes and dreams

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en: Ferial is a 48 year old married woman of three children. Her husband represents the main income source for the family in order to fulfill their family needs and being always ready to meet always their demands. Today, in order to pay her children study fees; she is applying for a new loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to help them and ensure them a suitable educational path.

loans.use: to pay her children study fees

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken has been involved in farming business for already 15 years. He is 50, living with his wife, mother and two children in Hovtashen village of Ararat region. Babken is a farmer following his family tradition. Currently he is involved in aviculture and cultivation of greens and apricot trees. The gathered harvest Babken sells locally and this is how family's only income is formed. Babken's son currently serves in the army, and that's why Babken has to handle farming works alone. He works hard to develop his farm so his family will have appropriate living conditions.

The requested loan is important for Babken to purchase seeds, polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, forage for hens and fuel for heating system, so his farm will continue functioning well and bringing income for family's living.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, forage for hens and fuel for heating system

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
This is Patience who is a single mother of 2 children. She describes herself as trustworthy.
She operates a retail business where she sells plastic chairs and tables, silver utensils and sauce pans. She has been involved in this business for 22 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be capital in-sustainability due to her role as a single parent
.
Patience will use GHS 3,800 loan to buy more plastic chairs and tables, silver utensils and sauce pans which she will sell to her customers. She hopes that in the future she can educate her children to university level and expand her business significantly.

This is her 11th loan with ID-Ghana and 4th with kiva. Her previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more plastic chairs and tables, silver utensils and sauce pan which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old married man from Zarqaa.
‎
Currently, Mohammad is pursuing a BSc. degree, majoring in Sociology at a university ‎located in the southern of Jordan. Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to cover his ‎university fees from the first to the fourth year, he would like to apply for a loan.
‎
With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover the year`s university ‎and go ‎through his university successfully. For his dreams, Mohammad wants to find a better job ‎with a reasonable salary.‎

loans.use: to pay for his university fees for a BSc. in Sociology

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Yusuf has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Yusuf can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yusuf will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Yusuf is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Pae Kone Village Group 2

texts.en: Thin and his fellow group members focus on raising livestock such as ducks and pigs. Their previous loan helped Pae Kone Village Group 2 increase investment in new businesses, such as expansion of their livestock.  Also, additional income was used to purchase more supply for their family grocery stores. The households can now afford using electricity in place of candles, allowing their children to study at night. The new loan will help the group purchase more ducks, high quality feeds and additional business expenses.

loans.use: to help the villagers purchase ducks, good quality feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Gaber

texts.en: Gaber is 52, married and has 3 children. He has a small fattening project and previously requested 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates. He is requesting 5000 EGP to buy a head of cattle to increase his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle to increase his family income

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, flour, canned food, cooking oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: He is 45 years old, married and blessed with four children.He has taken a loan to purchase farm inputs and do farming hoping this will generate income.This is his 15th year in business.  His hopes and dreams for the future is to grow the business, feed his family and pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 56 years old and single with four children.

Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Edna has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from peanut butter making.

Edna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Naomi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Naomi would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Naomi can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Naomi will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Naomi is thankful that she now has the opportunity to to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Isyaku

texts.en:
Isyaku is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Isyaku has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Isyaku can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Isyaku will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Isyaku is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Djguiseme Group

texts.fr: Hawa ; femme malienne âgée de  26 ans mariée et mère d’un enfant ; elle a appris à faire le cacaoté de poids de terre avec sa Mama a l’âge de 10 ans, aujourd’hui  elle  prépare une grande quantité de poids de terre grâce à la potentialité de sa clientèle, elle vent en grossiste dans les  marchés de sa localité ; elle peut réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80000f.  ses embussions la poussées vers le RMCR Mali pour solliciter un prêt important pour augmenter sa production en fin de pouvoir satisfaire la demande de ses clients Malgré la rentabilité de cette activité elle est heurté  à un problème de distribution ,Ses rêves c’ est d’acheter une moto taxi pour faciliter sa distribution.
texts.en: Hawa is a married, 26-year-old woman from Mali. She has one child. At the age of 10, she learned how to make ground cocoa using earthen weights with her mother. Today she makes a large quantity of earthen weights thanks to potential customers. She sells wholesale in the local markets. She can make a monthly profit of 80,000 francs. Her ambitions led her to RMCR Mali to ask for a large loan in order to increase her production to meet the needs of her customers. In spite of the profitability of the business, she has run into a distribution problem. It is her dream to buy a motorbike to help with her distribution.

loans.use: to buy earthen weights to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Sathio's Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis 25 Octobre,  ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  Sathio, (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 54ans mariée  et mère de 02 garçons 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 06 paniers de poissons à 25000fpour le revendre en détails dans son village en détails.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte s’occuper aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et s'occuper de ses enfants soins médicaux, habillements.
texts.en:
Created since the 25th of October, this group is made up of women who have experience with the program. Their main activity is petty trade.

Mrs Sathio (seated at the extreme right with her hand raised), is the group's featured borrower. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of two boys and two girls. She works in the sale of fish. With this new loan, she intends to buy six baskets of fish at 25 000 francs to retail in her village.

With her profits, she intends to help her husband with the daily expenses and take care of her children's medical and clothing needs.

loans.use: to buy six baskets of fish for 25 000 francs to retail in her village.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta has two children and is a hardworking entrepreneur. She sells clothing in the Philippines and earns additional income fattening pigs.

Violeta requested a loan from NWTF for 28,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks of clothes to sell. She hopes to to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Djembereng Group

texts.fr: le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en juillet 2013. Ce groupe est composé de femmes qui exercent le commerce, prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps et sont très solidaires. Madame Marie Paule qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire, âgée de quarante sept ans et mère de cinq enfants dont trois filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de produits cosmétiques, de chaussures et des fournitures scolaires depuis trois ans. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité trente paires de chaussures, quarante flacons de produits cosmétiques et un carton de cahiers. Elle est confrontée à une concurrence qui l'empêche parfois d'écouler rapidement sa marchandise. Les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
The banc villageois to which this group belongs was inaugurated in July 2013. This group is made up of women who work in trade, take loans that they repay on time and show a lot of solidarity.

Mrs Marie Paule, who is on the right of the photo raising her hand, is the group representative. She is single, forty-seven years old and the mother of five children including three girls. She has been selling cosmetic products, shoes and school supplies for three years. With the requested loan, she will buy thirty pairs of shoes, forty flasks of cosmetic products and a box of notebooks. She is confronted with competition that sometimes prevents her from quickly selling her stock.

The profits will serve to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, shoes and school supplies.

loans.name: Laazarus

texts.en:
Laazarus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Laazarus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Laazarus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Laazarus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Laazarus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Laazarus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la pesca artesanal, trabajo que le ayuda a poder salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su casa, el joven vive con sus padres en casa propia, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de trasmayos para continuar con la pesca y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is 22 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has worked as an artisanal fisherman for five years. This work helps him to get ahead covering his expenses at home. He lives with his parents in a home of their own. 

He is requesting a loan to buy trammel nets in order to continue fishing and in this way be able to get better income.

loans.use: to buy trammel nets.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
God continually molds the people who are willing to submit to His tending hands. Ana continues to learn how to have a pleasant lifestyle and character through the guidance of God and her co-fellowship members at CCT Credit Cooperative. She managed to turn her old habits into productive ways of income generation. Now she is operating this variety store combined with rice retailing and video rental. She can do this while taking care of her children and doing the household chores. She can manage all these with the help of her supportive husband, Jerry. They live in Matina, Davao City.

Ana normally experiences stiff competition in business, but she focuses on her goal to sustain the family's everyday expenses, provide for the educational needs of their children, and expand her business. She’s looking forward to the completion of her children’s education, which will give them better lives in the future. 

Ana aspires to have additional capital of PHP 40,000 for her business so she can gain extra profit and savings. She will use it to buy an additional stock of groceries and beverages, sacks of rice and videos for rent.

She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of groceries and beverages, sacks of rice and videos for rent

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 58 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, coffee, etc.

Felipa has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save money to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, coffee, etc

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Helen is borrowing PHP 180,00 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Iliya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Iliya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Iliya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 57 years old and married with six children, one of whom in school. Isabelita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Isabelita has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Isabelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Lileth

texts.en:
Lileth is 28 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

Lileth has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Lileth would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

Lilia has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to purchase another fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

loans.name: Nyormo Jormo Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called nyormo jormo and are on their 10th loan cycle. The members are hardworking members have gain a lot of experience in their various work, and each member is trying their utmost to be able to grow and succeed. They are into the sale of pastries, soft drinks and local food joint.

All the women in this group are very hard-working and entrepreneurial, but Ruth stands out. She sells pastries and plantain chips, and has many customers in the neighborhood as she has been running her business for 15 years. This provides herself. She is single and her children are grown up who are on their own.

She is requesting this loan to buy flour, margarine, sugar, plantain to prepare pastries and plantain chips, and also soft drinks which she will sell to her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy flour, margarine, sugar, plantain to prepare pastries and plantain chips which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sabanalamarino Unidos 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Matilde is the coordinator of her group, Sabanalamarinos Unidos 2 & 4 (This name is from their community). Her group is based in the Santo Domingo Norte. Most of the people who live in this part of the capital are citizens with many needs. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. Matilde is excited to take her 11th loan from Esperanza.

She plans to use this loan to improve her clothing sales. She sells second hands clothes that she buys in big packets and resells by the piece. This is very popular in Dominican Republic and Haiti. These clothes are often sold at flea markets.

Matilde says she enjoys doing business, and sharing with her family. Her most important dream is to have a successful business and to see her children become professionals. She will continue saving and re-investing her business profits. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: Leonito

texts.en:
Leonito is a 35-year-old married man. He lives in the rural area of Sagbayan, Bohol with his wife and three children. His oldest child is 14 while the youngest is 6. He earns a living by raising and selling hogs.

He is in need of funds to support his livelihood. He decided to increase his current business. Leonito is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner CEVI, because he has to buy piglets and feed. In this way, he would be able to cope with demand. He can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill any future needs.

Leonito is hoping that he will be successful in augmenting his hog raising source of income and to be able to finance his children's education.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Hurmat

texts.ru: Хурмат добропорядочная и трудолюбивая женщина из Зафарабадского района. Ей 55 лет и она мать троих сыновей. Муж Хурмат имеет земельный участок и заминается растениеводством, а в свободное время работает таксистом. Сыновья в данный момент находятся на заработках в России. Сама Хурмат вот уже 15 лет занимается шитьем.  Хурмат намерена в ближайшее время женить своего второго сына. Однако для новой невестки необходима хорошая комната.  Хурмат с этой целью обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет сделать в доме ремонт и отпраздновать свадьбу. Хурмат надеется на Ваше понимание.
texts.en:
Hurmat is a respectable and hardworking woman from Zafarobod region. She is 55 years old, and mother of three sons. Hurmat's husband has a land plot and grows crops; in his free time he works as a taxi driver. Her sons are currently working in Russia. Hurmat herself has been working as a seamstress for 15 years. 

Hurmat intends to marry off her second son in the near future. However, a good room is necessary for her new daughter-in-law. Hurmat is applying for a loan with this goal in mind. She wants to carry out repairs on her home, and to celebrate the wedding. Hurmat is hoping for your understanding.

loans.use: to carry out home repairs and celebrate a wedding.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
This is Romeo, 52 years old, a loving husband to Gina and a responsible father to his three children. He supports his family's everyday needs and educational expenses of his children with the aid of his hog raising venture. He also works as a surveyor in their municipality.

He’s been operating this business for ten years. Although the return of investment comes after several months, he’s happy to provide affordable meat for his community in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. He is planning to expand his business by buying additional piglets and feed. He is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan for this purpose. He hopes you are willing to help him so he can increase his profit and boost his savings.

He is looking forward to providing for his children’s education until completion. He knows that it’s the best inheritance that he can bestow on them.

He shares his experiences and aspirations to his co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Lorime

texts.en:
Lorime is 34 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Lorime works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Lorime has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future. Lorime would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Dzhumagul

texts.ru: Джумагуль, 54 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. В поиске дополнительного источника доходов для своей семьи, Джумагуль в 1989 году начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Джумагуль достигла хороших успехов и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 5 коров и 5 овец. На 1,0 Га собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает кукурузу, клевер и клубнику. Все накопленные средства она старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Однако в этом году решила построить сараи и баню, посоветовавшись с семьей, Джумагуль решила обратиться  в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на приобретение шифера, глины, цемента и прочего. Доходы же от бизнеса Джумагуль будет вкладывать в развитие своего бизнеса и строительство дома для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Dzhumagul is 54 and married with three children. In the search for an additional source of income for her family, she started working in animal husbandry and agriculture in 1989. Thanks to her hard work and constant effort, she has been very successful and now receives a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. She currently has five cows and five sheep on her farm as well as 1 hectare of her own and 1 hectare of rented land where she grows corn, clover and strawberries. 

She tries to put as much of her income as possible back into developing the business. However, this year she decided with her family's input to build a barn and a bathhouse. She decided to approach Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 KGS, which she will put toward buying slate, clay, cement and other necessary materials. She will put profits from the business toward further developing it and toward building a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy slate, clay, cement, etc. to build a barn and bathhouse

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn, 27, is a married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jenelyn has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 1 year. She requested a 5,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell in her business.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell in her business.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is a woman with three children. She is 27 years old and two of her children are in school. Ronalyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ronalyn has a buy-and-sell accessories business in the Philippines. Ronalyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of accessories to sell.

Ronalyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ronalyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of accessories to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year. She earns additional income from buying and selling rice grain.

She is borrowing 23,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos desde hace 10 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes, colocando techo y piso ceramico, pero no tiene de suficiente capital para realizarlo por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios y asi poder tener mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 58, lives in her own house with her daughter. She has been selling traditional snacks for ten years. Her business is located at her house. She manages to get ahead with what she gets from her sales.

She wants to improve her house by plastering the walls, installing a roof, and laying the floor with cermanic tiles. However, she does not have enough capital to do so. This is the reason that she is requesting a loan to buy the needed construction materials. This way she will have better living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy the needed construction materials.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with three children. Marites is 43 years old and one of her children is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marites has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Marites has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is 33 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Rena works very hard to provide for them.

Rena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

Rena has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries.

In the future, Rena would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
Dioleta, 50, is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.

Dioleta is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dioleta has been in this business for 10 years, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dioleta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shirts, pants, skirts, etc.

Merlinda has been in this business for 15 years. She has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shirts, pants, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Luzminda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Luzminda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Silina

texts.en:
Silina is a courageous woman who has been helping alone two kids and her mother. Her son, aged 24, became blind in 2004 due to glaucoma.

Silina started her small business with only US $23 in 2007. She used to sell foodstuffs and national rice long before that. The political instability added up to the insecurity that Haiti knew in 2004 and made her stop selling in the marketplace. The business has been brought home. She sells less than before due to the lack of products.

Thanks to a first loan in Zafen, Silina was able to pay for transportation for her son, who is now at the state university. Therefore, Silina is looking for a loan to replenish her financial activity.

loans.use: to buy more food products in bulk to retail.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes owns a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household commodities like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, sugar, edible oil, seasonings, soap, toothpaste, shampoo and mosquito repellent.

She is 42 years old and a married woman who has three children.

Aside from running a sari-sari (variety) store, she also engages in farming and grows rice. She decided to take the loan to have additional capital to make her source of income more productive.

She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for the store and fertilizers for the farm. These will keep the merchandise in her store and ensure a good harvest also to improve her income.

Lourdes is grateful for the funds, and she is doing her best to continue to support the schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store and fertilizers for the farm.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amelita is 26 years old and two of her children are in school.

Amelita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as a pig, condiments, etc.

Amelita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as a pig, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.en:
Edilberta is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edilberta is 65 years old and has three children who are in school.

Edilberta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Edilberta requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Edilberta has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Edilberta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 44 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school. Marialyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, chips, eggs, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

Marialyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Marialyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, chips, eggs, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 58 years old and two of her children are in school.

Erlinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as condiments, fruits, etc.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as condiments, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Motk Group

texts.en:
Guirlene is the leader of a group of 24 women and six men. Her group is involved in developing small economic activities such retailing personal products and solidarity building. Like many Zafen borrowers, Guirlene receives basic training to manage the group better.

If the loan is granted, Guirlene will be able to feed her children during the school year. So will many other people in her group. Therefore, she would like to find a loan to buy more products in bulk to render them accessible to the rural people of her neighborhood.

Guirlene (left) is pictured with Renold (middle) and Vilina (right) as the group's committee board.

loans.use: to purchase 50 racks of soft drinks and food products to retail.

loans.name: Benjamin De Jesus

texts.es:
Benjamín es un agricultor especializado en la producción de café de alta calidad, a sus 33 años de edad tiene más de 15 años de experiencia en la producción de café y más de 5 años en la preparación de cafés especiales que comercializa directamente con sus compradores con el apoyo de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, Benjamín es Padre de 4 hijos, la principal meta de Benjamín es poder darles a sus hijos una vida digna y que puedan aprender a trabajar el café de la mejor manera posible.
Benjamín es muy amigo de la calidad por lo que tiene certificado su cafetal como: Comercio Justo, orgánico y UTZ, además para mejorar la calidad del café lo prepara en secadoras solares, el preparado del café en secadoras solares acentúa los sabores y aromas del grano además de homogenizar su humedad para hacer más lento el proceso de degradación en bodega razón por la cual este café es muy preferido por muchos compradores.
Benjamín solicita un crédito para reparar sus secadoras solares que están ya muy degradadas por el tiempo, el crédito le ayudara a comprar los materiales tales como madera,  Nylon entre otros.
El crédito ayudara a Benjamín a continuar preparando su café en las más óptimas condiciones posibles lo que le permite optar a mejores mercados para su producción, con las ganancias obtenidas por el café Benjamín quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida e invertir para preparar mejor café.
texts.en:
Benjamín is a farmer specializing in the production of high quality coffee. At his 33 years of age he has over 15 years of experience in coffee production and over five years in the preparation of specialized coffee. He sells directly to his buyers with the support of COCAFCAL, where he is a member.

Benjamín has four children. His primary goal is to be able to give his children a decent life and that they are able to learn to work the coffee in the best way possible.

Benjamín is a good friend of quality, and his coffee farm is certified as Fair Trade, orgainic, and "UTZ" [ sustainable farming and better opportunities for farmers, their families and our planet]. In addition, in order to improve the quality of the coffee, he prepares it in solar dryers. Preparing the coffee in solar dryers accentuates the flavors and aromas of the beans. It also homoginizes the humidity in order to slow the process of degradation in storage. This is the reason that this coffee is much preferred by many buyers.

Benjamín is requesting a loan to repair his solar dryers that are degraded by time. The loan will help him to buy materials like wood and nylon, among others. The loan will help Benjamín to continue preparing coffee in the most optimal conditions possible. This will allow him to select the best markets for his production. With the earnings from the coffee Benjamín wants to improve his living conditions and invest in order to prepare better coffee.

loans.use: to buy wood, nylon, sieves, and nails to repair his solar dryers in order to process quality coffee.

loans.name: Armida Ruth

texts.es: Armida de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado frente a la alcaldía municipal, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando y cambiando el techo pero con posee de suficiente capital para realizarlo por esa razon está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de materiales de construccion para poder mejorar su casa como siempre la ha querido.
texts.en: Armida is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has been selling clothes for various years. Her business is located in front of the town hall. With the sales she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She wants to improve her house with cement and wants to replace the roof but she does not have enough money to do this. For this reason she is requesting the loan, to purchase construction materials to improve her home, which is what she has always wanted.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador, de 72 años de edad, es agricultor, no posee ningún conocimiento sobre educación básica, actualmente está casada y tiene tres hijos los cuales todos están acompañados y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Salvador, desde muy joven se dedicó a trabajar cultivos, porque siempre ha sido lo que en su vida le ha apasionado, recuerda muy bien que desde los doce años trabaja fuerte, para realizar sus propios trabajos; en la actualidad trabaja dos hectáreas de maíz nixtamal con frijol para aprovechar la tierra.

Salvador, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes como abono y fórmula para que su cultivo tenga un excelente desarrollo.

Su sueño principal es tener una buena cosecha, la cual le sirva para pagar crédito, dejar granos para su consumo.
texts.en:
Salvador is 72 years old. He is a farmer. He has no formal education. He is married and has three children, who are all married. His wife is a housewife.

Salvador has worked in farming since young age because it has always been his passion. He remembers very well that he’s worked hard for twelve years to make it his own work. Currently, he works on two hectares of corn and bean to take advantage of the land.

Salvador requests a loan to buy fertilizer and formula for his crops to develop well.

His main dream is to have a good harvest. This will help pay off the loan and leave grains for consumption.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and formula for his crops to develop well.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 26 years old and married, with one child in school.

Gladys is in an agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gladys has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gladys would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling rice grains.

Nilda dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José, de 56 años de edad, no posee ningún conocimiento básico sobre estudios académicos, actualmente está casado, dentro de su matrimonio procreó dos hijos y ambos están casados, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José, desde muy joven trabajó en la agricultura, porque su padre era agricultor, cuando el tenía 18 años empezó a arar la tierra con los bueyes; actualmente realiza esta actividad pero también realiza sus propios cultivos, en los cuales trabaja una hectárea de maíz.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar plaguicidas y fertilizantes, porque su cultivo de maíz tiene plaga y necesita combatirla para obtener buenos resultados de su cosecha.

Su objetivo principal, es tener una cosecha mejor que la del año pasado.
texts.en:
José, aged 56, does not have any academic education. He is now married, and with his wife had two children who are now both married. His wife looks after the household.

Since he was very young, José worked in agriculture, as his father was a farmer. When he was 18 he started to plow the land with oxen, which he still does now, but he also looks after his own crops, consisting of a hectare of corn.

José needs this loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers, as his corn has an infestation which he needs to combat in order to have a good harvest.

His main aim is to have a better harvest than last year.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is from the community of Jagna in the province of Bohol. She is a mother to three children who are already adults. Roberta spends her time farming, hog raising and operating a Sari-sari store business. She sells snacks, canned goods, noodles, toiletries and seasoning in her store. Her business allows her to generate an average income of PHP 2,000 per month.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, feed, sachet items of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food and biscuits. In the future, she plans to buy more products that she can introduce to her customers and fill her shelves for a better return on her investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed, sachet items of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner,  canned food and biscuits

loans.name: Omega Madel

texts.en:
Omega Madel is 35 years old and has two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

Omega Madel requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Omega Madel has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Omega Madel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Japie

texts.en:
Japie is a single woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Japie is 24 years old and has three children who are in school.

Japie has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Japie requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Japie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Japie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is 64 years old; she is a widow with five grown up children. Her businesses are hog raising and selling eel. She had been in these businesses for over five years now. She is now asking for a loan of P 10,000 to buy feed for her hogs' sustenance and eel to resell for profit. She hopes to continue making good profits and saving for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs' sustenance and eel to resell for profit.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 42 years old, married and has eight children. She is selling vegetables for income. She uses her profits to buy food for daily meals and capital for her small business. Melody is now asking for a loan of P 10,000 to buy eggplant, tomatoes and squash to sell.

Someday, she hopes to save some of her profits for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, tomatoes and squash to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old, married and has two children. She is a vendor selling different foods for snacks. Sometimes, she also sells vegetables. Josephine wants to sell more foods such as ice candy and other snacks for added income. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy milk, sugar and other ingredients in making ice candy.

In the future, Josephine hopes to continue improving her profits for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar and other ingredients in making ice candy to sell

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lelia is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Lelia has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Lelia has been in this business for eight years. In the future, shewould like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 45 years old; she is married, with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Rebecca has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough to buy farm lands.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a single woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 65 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lourdes has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc..

Lourdes has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricel is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maricel has a buy-and-sell personal product care business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like roll on, perfume, etc..

Maricel has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like roll on, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Ruditha

texts.en: Ruditha is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fishing. Ruditha requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory of canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Ruditha dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell in her store.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. Shirley earns more income from a restaurant. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell for her butcher shop business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Farhana

texts.en:
Farhana is 30 years old; she is a married lady. She is a very talented lady, and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation in her community.

Some years ago, she started her business of tailoring in order to run her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She has now requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings.

She wishes to spend the income on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en:
Faaiuga is a 38-year-old married woman with two children. She sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has more than 10 years of experience with this business.

Faaiuga needs a loan to buy a fishing net, a spear, goggles and a fishing boat. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially, and to save for unexpected emergencies.

Faaiuga has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a spear, goggles and a fishing boat.

loans.name: Ela

texts.en:
Ela is 50 years old and married, with 6 children. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for four years.

Ela has requested a loan to buy seeds, a spade, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and a weed sprayer .

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital.

With her earnings, Ela will save more for her children's education and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy seeds, a spade, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and a weedsprayer.

loans.name: Sarai

texts.en:
Sarai is a 33-year-old married woman with 5 children. She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living.

Sarai has requested a loan to buy a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, seeds, a rake and a weed sprayer.

She has been a member of SPBD since September, 2015 to gain access to financial services.

Sarai will spend her profits to support her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, seeds, a rake and a weedsprayer.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 39 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales y panes relleno, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de productos que solicitan sus productos. Mercedes logro comprar su vivienda hace 15 años, y en ella vive actualmente junto a sus 3 hijos de 19, 15 y 9 años de edad. Mercedes desea invertir en productos para su negocio, ya que no logra cumplir con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: harina, maíz, pollo, repollo, aderezos, entre otros productos necesarios para su venta de tamales y panes rellenos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a hard working woman who at 39 years old, works making and selling tamales and stuffed breads. She has been doing this for 12 years, therefore she has a great number of customers who ask for her products. Mercedes was able to buy her home 15 years ago and she currently lives with her 3 children, who are 19, 15 and 9 years old.

Mercedes would like to invest in products for her business because she can't meet her customers demand of the products. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: flour, corn, chicken, cabbage and seasonings among other necessary products for the sale of her tamales and stuffed breads.

loans.use: to invest in: flour, corn, chicken, cabbage and seasonings, among other necessary products for the sale of her tamales and  stuffed breads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric so that she can start making uniforms and outfits for this year's graduating class.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en: Amna is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Amna is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of supplies, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily needs related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. With the loan, she wants to purchase thread of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.  She hopes to get an increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Like many women, it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging our client Shumaila to approach Kashf Foundation in search of a loan.

Shumaila is a 33-year-old married woman, and a mother of three children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Silia

texts.en:
Silia is a 36-year-old married woman with 4 children. She plans to start a small business, planting and selling vegetables in her community for a living.

Silia needs a loan to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds. She will use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially.

Silia joined SPBD in the beginning of this month to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy gardening tools.

loans.name: Fonofili

texts.en:
Fonofili is a 35-year-old married woman with 6 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business.

Fonofili needs a loan to buy bags of flour, baking soda, vegetable oil, a bag of sugar and a fryer. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to pay for her children's school fees.

Fonofili has been a member of SPBD since the beginning of this month October 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pancakes to sell.

loans.name: Mandy

texts.en:
Mandy is a 24-year-old single woman with no child. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption goods such as drinks, snacks, frozen food and more. She has been doing this for more than 10 years.

Mandy needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, bags of rice, drinks, bags of chicken, sausages, snacks and more. She hopes to use her profits to support her family financially and to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in October this year 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Aukusitina

texts.en:
Aukusitina is a 34-year-old woman who is married with 3 children. She plans to start a small business, planting and selling vegetables in her community for a living.

Aukusitina needs a loan to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds. She will use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially.

Aukusitina joined SPBD in the begining of this month to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy gardening tools & supplies.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia lives in Solana with her family. She is 34 years old, married and had four children.

To make a living, Amalia sells fish and freshwater eels. She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy an apparatus to use in fishing. She hopes to achieve better profits in her small business and save funds to use for her family's emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Faalataina

texts.en:
Faalatina is a 40-year-old married woman with no child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a bag of sugar, bags of flour, vegetable oil, baking soda, and an oven.

In the future, Faalatina hopes to save more of her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in the beginning of September this year 2015 gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, oil, baking soda and an oven.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 43 years old and married with one child who is in school. Jenelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Jenelyn has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

Jenelyn has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, school supplies and other groceries.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 64 years old, married and has three children.

Marcelina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Marcelina has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines & vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Madaki Dutse village.

As a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Ibrahim will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% above the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to USD 2,000 per hectare, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and he plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem has struggled a lot with her husband's low income. It was very hard to fulfill the basic necessities of life, so she initiated her business of tailoring.

At the age of 61, Naseem is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the customer orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Naseem hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Saleeman

texts.en:
Saleeman, age 43, is a married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of their family members alone.

Saleeman is a motivated mother of 4 children. She is liable to provide them with good quality food, health and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan of 45000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profit on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy materials to make footballs to sell.

loans.name: Amatigue Group

texts.fr: Aminata est la femme qui tient les cornes du bélier sur la photo. Aminata est une malienne, âgée de  49 ans, non alphabétisée, mariée et mère de 3 enfants,  âgés de  17 ans  à 22 ans dont  un scolarisé. Aminata fait l’élevage des ovins, Elle fait  recourt au prêt  du  RMCR  pour  acheter des moutons. Elle les élève puis  les revend au comptant dans  les  foires   des  différentes  localités ,  environnants  et  souvent à  des revendeurs à domicile. Elle est souvent confrontée   à certaines difficultés la mévente et les maladies d’animaux.  Mais elle   trouve généralement la solution avec certains éleveurs du village. Elle a 20 ans d’expérience. Aminata  souhaite  dans l’avenir,  l’accroissement de son entreprise en achetant beaucoup  de  béliers  et gagner plus de profit afin de prendre toute les petite dépenses  de sa famille il s’agit : les soins de santé,  les frais de condiments, et les frais de scolarité
texts.en:
Aminata is the woman holding the ram’s horns in the photo. She is Malian, 49 years old, illiterate, married, and the mother of three children aged 17 to 22 years old, of whom one is in school. Aminata is a livestock farmer of sheep. She has turned to loans from RMCR to purchase some sheep. She raises them, then resells them for cash at the fairs in the different nearby towns and often to retailers at home. She is often confronted with certain problems, drops in sales and animal illnesses. But she generally finds the solution with certain livestock farmers in the village. She has twenty years of experience.

Aminata’s wish for the future is to grow her enterprise by purchasing many rams and earning more profit to cover all the various family expenses, mainly the costs of healthcare, food, and schooling.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to resell later

loans.name: Marìa Lucia

texts.es:
María con 32 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo e hijos, en el distrito de Tumán, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. María cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales (cerdos, cuyes y gallinas).Cría vacas productores de leche. Su conviviente se dedica a brindar mano de obra agrícola en Olmos en cultivos de particulares de caña de azúcar. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y gastos de consumo diversos que se presentan.De este modo dará una mejor atención y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en su calidad de vida.

María cuenta con experiencia crediticia en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, con pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old, married, and lives in her own house with her husband and children in Tuman district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department in Peru.

Maria is dedicated to raising and selling farm animals (including pigs, guinea pigs, and hens). And she also raises milk cows. Her life's companion is an agricultural worker in Olmos, working on private farms that raise sugar cane.

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase more farm animals, and to cover the costs of the diverse animal feeds that will be required. In this way, she will be able to offer them better attention and generate added income that will improve the family's quality of life.

Maria can count on her good credit experience with our institution, Edpyme Alternativa, having made all her past payments punctually.

loans.use: buy more  farm animals and cover the costs of the diverse feeds they will require.

loans.name: Selesa

texts.en:
Selesa is 34 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows ava (kava) that she can sell in her community, or at the market, to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Selesa needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, spade, knives etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Selesa will use the profits from her sales to support her family financially and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarow, spade, knives etc

loans.name: Melinda Fe

texts.en:
Melinda Fe is 48 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Melinda Fe works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Melinda Fe has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Zubida was living a tough life some years ago, as it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is a 55-year-old married woman.

With the help of her husband, she has been running a business of selling milk for many years. She has buffaloes for milking. She sells the milk in her area.

Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing her milk sales in order to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales in order to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a hardworking, 49-year-old married man who earns a living raising and selling livestock like cows. He has been engaged in raising livestock for five years now.

Six of his children are still attending school. Together with his family, he lives in the town of Clarin, Bohol.

He wants to continue improving his quality of life, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy more cows and thus continue to improve his business. Thus, he would able to raise more cows and continue to support his family.


Romeo dream of having another source of income that could be sustainable and able to finance the schooling of his youngest child.

loans.use: to buy more  cows.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a 48-year-old single man who offers habal-habal (motorcycle) transportation services to the people in his town. For almost 13 years now he has been into that livelihood.

He would like to access loans from CEVI to purchase motorcycle accessories and tires. These will help improve his services and to gratefully serve his passengers daily.

As a result, his income will improve and slowly he could pay his obligation. Also, he could start saving some of the profit for future use.

Rolando hopes to gain high earnings so as to make his living more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle accessories and tires

loans.name: Apoua

texts.en:
Apoua is a 38-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows ava (kava) and vegetables that she sells in her community to make a living. Apoua needs a loan to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer, and vegetable seeds. 

She will use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. Apoua joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer, and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Niña is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Niña is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, like lotion and soap, etc.

Niña has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like lotion and soap, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 55 years old and married with eight children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Judith has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, school supplies, noodles and other groceries.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Olivier Jules

texts.fr:
