A 44 ans, Olivier est divorcé il y a maintenant 10 ans. Sa femme s’est déjà mariée.  Il a trois enfants, l’ainé de 24  ans travaille, le second âgé 19 ans est déjà marié, le dernier qui a 14 ans vit avec lui et, est encore étudiant (classe de cinquième).
Olivier a débuté l’activité de vente de pantalons jean d’occasion (friperie) en 2008. Avant, il travaillait dans une entreprise franche de confection de vêtements. L’idée de se lancer dans cette activité était née de la connaissance du secteur après la fermeture de l’entreprise. Avec ses sept années d’expérience dans l’activité, il connaît bien le secteur : choix de la qualité des marchandises. Il dispose deux points de vente. 
Son objectif est de se spécialiser dans le secteur par la vente de marchandises de première qualité venant de l’extérieur.
Le développement de l’activité de vente de pantalons Jean dépend de l’existence de produits diversifiés répondant aux besoins des clients : taille, couleur, forme et quantité.
texts.en:
Olivier, aged 44, has been divorced for ten years. His wife is already married. He has three children. The oldest, a son, is 24 and working. The second, a son, is 19 and married. And the last is 14, still a student (5th grade), and living with him.

Olivier began his business selling used jeans in 2008. Before, he used to work at a free zone clothing maker. The idea of launching his business came out of having known the sector after the enterprise closed. With his seven years of experience in this work, he knows it well: choices of quality merchandise. He has two sales outlets.

His goal is to become specialized in the sector by selling top quality merchandise from abroad.

Developing the business of selling jeans depends on there being diversified products answering customer needs: size, color, style, and quantity.

loans.use: to purchase 120 secondhand jeans

loans.name: Fesauai

texts.en:
Fesauai is a 42-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Fesauai needs a loan to buy bags of flour, baking soda, vegetable oil, a bag of sugar, and a fryer. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to pay for her children's school fees. Fesauai  has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, bags of flour, vegetable oil, an oven and baking soda

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado es un agricultor especializado en la producción de café de alta calidad, a sus 53 años de edad tiene más de 25 años de experiencia en la producción de café y más de 5 años en la producción de cafés certificados que comercializa con el apoyo de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, Amado está casado con Sara y han procreado 9 hijos de los cuales 6 están bajo su cargo, la principal meta de Amado es poder darles a sus hijos una vida digna y que puedan aprender a trabajar para que sean personas de bien.
Amado es muy apasionado por aprender nuevas técnicas para producir café de calidad por lo que tiene certificado su cafetal como: Comercio Justo, UTZ y Rainforest ahora para mejorar la calidad de su café Amado quiere convertir sus cafetales a 100% orgánico esto hará más sostenibles y amigables con el ambiente sus cafetales además le dará mejores oportunidades de mercado a su producción.
En la actualidad Amado solicita un crédito para iniciar las labores de conversión a orgánico de su cafetal tal como: comprar abonos orgánicos, Plantar barreras de conservación del suelo, mejorar las instalaciones de su finca para cuidar de la calidad orgánica.
El crédito ayudara a Amado a iniciar las labores conversión a orgánico, esto le ayudara a poder vender su café a mejores precios, hará su finca más sostenible, con las ganancias obtenidas por el café vendido Amado espera mejorar sus ingresos para que su familia mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Amado is a farmer specialized in the production of high quality coffee. At 53, he has more than 25 years of experience producing coffee and more than 5 years of experience in the production of certified coffee, which he sells with the support of COCAFCAL where he is a member.

Amado is married to Sara and have 9 children, of which 6 of them are under their care. Amado's main goal is to provide a decent life for his children so that they can learn to work and become good people.

Amado is very passionate about learning new techniques in order to produce quality coffee. This is why he has his coffee plantation certified as: Fair Trade, UTZ, and Rainforest. To improve the quality of his coffee, Amado wants to turn his plantation to 100% organic. This will make his plantation more sustainable, environmentally friendly and in addition, it will give his production better market opportunities.

Amado is currently requesting a loan to start the work to turn his coffee plantation into organic, such as: buying organic fertilizers, placing soil conservation barriers, improving his farm and facilities to care for the organic quality.

The loan will help Amado to start the work to convert to organic, this will help him sell his coffee at better prices and will make his farm more sustainable. With the earnings from the sale of the coffee, Amado hopes to increase his income and improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers, organic coffee plants and other materials needed to turn his coffee plantation organic.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ofelia is 61 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is a single woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rose Marie is 22 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rose Marie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rose Marie requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, spices, etc.

Rose Marie has been in this business for one year. In the future, Rose Marie would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 38 años de edad, es madre soltera quien vive de manera humilde junto a sus hijos de 7, 17 y 18 años y su hija de 20 años de edad. Dora es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora que ofrece sus servicios domésticos en una vivienda que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad, dicha actividad lleva varios años realizando, además los días que tiene libres los utiliza para vender comida típica como lo son las papitas fritas, pasteles y yuca y de esta manera obtener mayores ingresos para los gastos del hogar, y así satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. La casa en la que habita es humilde en donde ha vivido desde hace 2 años. Dora solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: repollo, tomates, papas, yuca, mayonesa, salsa dulce  entre  muchas cosas más que necesita para la preparación de estos platillos típicos, que son el medio con el cual obtiene ingresos económicos que le permiten sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dora is 38 years old. She is a single mother who lives in a humble manner together with her 7 and 17 year old sons and her 20 year old daughter. Dora is a very responsible and hard-working person who works offering her domestic services in a house that is close to her community. She has been doing this activity for several years. Besides this, she uses her days off to sell traditional foods like fries, pastries and yucca. In this way she obtains more income for the household expenses and satisfy the basic needs of her family. The house they live in is simple and they have lived there for two years.

Dora is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, yucca, mayonnaise and ketchup amongst many other things that she needs for the preparation of her traditional dishes, as this is the manner in which she obtains her economic income which allows her to raise her children.

loans.use: to invest in cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, yucca, mayonnaise and ketchup amongst many other things that she needs for the preparation of her traditional dishes.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a buy-and-sell brooms busiiness in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of brooms.

Adelaida industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like buying and selling rice grains.

She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of brooms.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish for drying and selling.

She has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for drying and selling.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Teresita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fryer chicken chicks and some feed

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 64 years old and married with four children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, school supplies, noodles, and other groceries.

Letecia has borrowed and paid back 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a computer shop and from raising livestock businesses.

Letecia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, school supplies, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Santina

texts.en:
Santina has been involved in business activities since 2010. She started with her own working capital of $150. She has a kiosk in front of her house.

She is applying for a loan of $ 1,000. She has come to the age of 25. Her husband is a businessman also.

Santina is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She will buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, including noodles, rice, sugar, cooking oils, slippers, candies, sardines, milks and biscuits, as well as soft drinks and hard drinks and other things.

She is happy with the loan that was offered to her by Tuba Rai Metin, because with this loan she can improve the management of her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar, cooking oils, slippers, candies, sardines, milks and biscuits to sell, as well as soft drinks and hard drinks and other things.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en: Bonifacia has started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has manage to have enough inventories and gain more profits. Everyday she made good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to mount a descent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

loans.name: Lucas Antonio

texts.es: Lucas de 38 años de edad, tiene 4 años de residir en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 12 años de edad. Él cuenta con un negocio de venta de verduras, ya que se desempeña como agricultor y los cultivos que cosecha los comercializa permitiéndole obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para mantener la economía del hogar, y de esta forma velar porque a su familia no le falte nada. Además de su cosecha, invierte en más verduras para aumentar sus productos, ya que tiene 20 años de dedicarse a este negocio, y cuenta con una cantidad bastante grande de clientes que lo prefieren. Es por esto que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tomates, repollo, chiles, zanahorias, cebollas, entre otras verduras para obtener más productos para sus ventas, obtener mayores ganancias y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucas is 38 years old. He has lives in his own house for four years together with his life companion and his 12 year old daughter. He has a business selling vegetables as he is a farmer and he sells his harvests. This allows him to obtain the economic income he needs to support the household economy and in this way see that the family is lacking nothing.

Besides his harvest he invests in more vegetable to augment his produce. He has been in this business for 20 years and he has a fairly large quantity of clients who prefer him. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in tomatoes, cabbage, chilies, carrots and onions amongst other vegetables to expand his business and make greater profit and thus improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to invest in tomatoes, cabbage, chilies, carrots and onions amongst other vegetables to expand his business and make greater profit.

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is a 44-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish for her dried fish making.

Antonietta has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish for her dried fish making

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 31 years old and married, with three children. With three children in school, Sharon works very hard to provide for them.

Sharon runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 8,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Sharon has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Sharon would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Iselsa

texts.en:
Iselsa, from the city of Santo Domingo, is taking a housing loan. This is her 14th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She runs a Colmado (a grocery store) in her neighborhood and this is her main incoming activity, she started her business 7 years ago with less than US$2.00. Her latest loan was invested in the business.

Esperanza International runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses, and who have shown faithfulness in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as they are running their businesses and attending their group meetings.

Iselsa wants to finish building her house. With this loan, she will buy cement, rods, concrete blocks and other building material to change her zinc roof for a concrete one, and also her wooden walls for concrete blocks. She wishes to have a safe and nice home to share with her family which is compounded by 6 children and her husband. Thanks to God's will, she will be able to take a closer step to finish building her home, and she can save more from her business profits. She thanks God, Esperanza International, and all of you for this opportunity. Thanks to all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks and cement to finish building her house.

loans.name: Tone Kwa Village Group

texts.en:
Featured borrower Tin and her team members aim to purchase ducklings and high quality feeds. Their previous loan helped their families purchase feed for duck loans. Additional income from their affordable loans allowed them to cover daily expenses, as well as invest in secondary businesses such as small family stores.

Tin and her husband farm their five acre crop farm. Her son, currently in primary education, hopes to study until high school graduation. Additional income from their loan will help Tin and her husband pay their son’s education tuition.

loans.use: to help the villagers purchase ducks as well as high quality feeds.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is 38 years old vigorous, married woman and mother of 3 children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Zeenat ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. She hopes to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time

loans.name: Lelit

texts.en:
Lelit is a hard-working, 33-year-old, married woman. She has three children ages 5, 7 and 9 years old. Lelit hails from the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. She has been raising hogs for 5 years. Her husband has also an income that helps defray the family's daily expenses.

Lelit decided to take out a loan to buy additional pigs and feed. In this way, she hopes to increase her income. With the availability of additional resources, Lelit can purchase more pigs. This will enable her to maintain her earnings for a longer period of time.

With sustained earnings, she can continue to finance the schooling of her children, and afford to buy nutritious meals for the whole family.

Lelit successfully repaid her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Elias Alberto

texts.es: Elías de 28 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia, en la que ha vivido desde hace 5 años. Vive al lado de su hijo de 5 años de edad y su compañera de vida quien le ayuda con la economía del hogar gracias a que ella presta sus servicios en una pupuseria. Elías en busca de mantener la economía del hogar se dedica a la venta de bebidas frías fuera de su vivienda en donde es transitado por muchas personas. Además se dedica a la venta de hielo a comerciantes de la misma zona, en donde ya es reconocido por todos y esto hace que lo prefieran. De esta manera ha aumentado las ventas y por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en bebidas frías para aumentar los productos de su negocio y de esta forma aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Elías is 28 years old and has been living in his own house for the past five years. He lives with his 5 year old son and his life companion. She helps him with the household economy as she works in a grocery store.

Elías looking to support the household economy, works selling cold drinks outside his house which has many people passing by. Besides this he sells ice to the merchants in the same area where he is well-known and thus has their preference. His sales have increased so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cold drinks to increase the products in his business and in this way increase his sales.

loans.use: to invest in cold drinks to increase the products in his business and in this way increase sales.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Doña Tomasa de 67 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes,se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años y asi como ha podido solventar los gastos que se le presentan, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Tomasa, who is 67 years old, works in a house she owns with her husband. She works making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many clients. She has has this occupation for several years, and it is in this way that she has managed to settle the expenses that come before her. She is asking for a loan to buy maize at wholesale and lime to be able to continue with her work, as this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy maize at wholesale and lime.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
La socia  Salome se dedica al negocio de venta de maiz,la socia vende en diferentes mercados, la socia por medio de este negocio le gustaría abrir una tienda de abarrotes, ella es una personas muy emprendedora y quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Salome works selling corn. She sells in different markets. Through this business, she would like to open a grocery store. She is an entrepreneurial person and wants to get ahead. She is asking for the loan to buy corn. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with her fee payments.

loans.use: to buy corn for resale

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a hardworking female entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ana Marie dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alhaji Basiru

texts.en:
Alhaji Basiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Alhaji Basiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Basiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Alhaji Basiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Basiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Alhaji Basiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, young engaged lady lives in Irbid with her family and her fiance is working in ‎Palestine, she hopes to graduate to be able to get married and go with her husband to ‎Palestine. ‎

She is very ambitious lady, studying Industrial Engineering in her second year, she attends to ‎very simple family and her father could not cover her semester fees, therefore she applied ‎for a loan to help her pay for her university and achieve what she dreams all her life. ‎

loans.use: to cover her university fees for a BSc. in Industrial Engineering.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is a 27 year old Lebanese married woman for three school aged children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. He owns a car mechanical shop. Hiba at this period is in a real need of a little help from kiva. For that reason, she is requesting for a loan from kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them with the coming school year. She said that she is happy that she will be able to ensure her children a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them with the coming school year

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is a 30 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and mother of two children still studying.  Her husband owns a snack and as for her she works as a hairdresser in her house in order to help her husband financially. Currently, she is demanding a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. She states that with her Kiva loan, she will be able to help her children to pursue their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 47 years old and is from Bacundao East, Malasiqui, Pangasinan. She has 6 children, and one of them is Jhon Paul who is studying in ASKI and doing a Microfinance Technology course.

Loreta is having difficulties sending all of her children to school because of a lack of finances. For this reason she wants to take out an education loan of PHP 43,000 through Kiva lenders in order to send her son Jhon Paul to school.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is 34 years old and married with two children, and she works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, eggs, sugar, etc.

Diosa has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Iliya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Iliya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Iliya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia  is 45 year old, married woman. She has been doing a business of selling fruits for many years with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She is very enthusiastic in her work and manages to earn reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of 6 children. She is responsible for their food, health and clothing and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. For the improvement for her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently which ultimately enable her to cover her utility bills timely.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently which ultimately enable her to cover her utility bills timely

loans.name: Buenas Vecinas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BUENAS VECINAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de muebles, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, venta de jugos, venta de coca, venta de sombreros, venta de tarjetas telefónicas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elisa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por una promoción de la institución, que se realizó en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá y con los pocos ahorros con los que contaba decidió emprender su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará todos los días en las ferias locales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “BUENAS VECINAS” [Good Neighbors] communal bank are starting their sixth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors with Elisa as President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Amongst them are: the sales of shawls, selling furniture, selling sport's clothing, a neighborhood store, the sale of juices, selling coca leaves, the sale of hats and selling phone cards.

The loan they are taking out will benefit all these small micro-entrepreneurs, Elisa being one of them. She says that she has belonged to Pro Mujer for three years joining during a promotion of the institution that took place in her area. She presently has a business selling shawls. She says that she learned this business from her mother and with the little savings she had decided to start her own business.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying shawls wholesale) that she will acquire at the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later sell them every day at the local fairs. This method of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the training and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy shawls wholesale.

loans.name: Miền And Friends Group

texts.en:
Mrs Miền is 51 years old and she is married. She has been operating a fish stall for more than ten years. Miền lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region and income from this business is unstable because the price and amount of fish depend on the weather conditions.

The main hardship that Miền faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

In 2013, Miền joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Miền is the group leader of the Miền and Friends Group, which consists of three members.

In the future, Miền hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to maintain a successful business and she hopes that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
As a previous Kiva borrower, Constance is looking to expand her business by being funded again.

Since her first loan, Constance has managed to expand to fifteen outlets and she is looking to keep this momentum going, as this will improve her standard of living as well as that of her husband and child. Her main objective is to make easy, quick and most important, safe money transfer facilities accessible to everyone in the rural communities of Zambia.

Currently, Constance uses the revenue generated by her Zoona outlets to generate capital in order to expand her business and be a source of employment in his community. She already employs 25 people across different Zambian towns. She would also like to use some of the revenue generated to empower herself by finishing her studies, which she is currently doing part time.

Being able to run her own business by having been able to open these Zoona outlets has allowed Constance to keep her family afloat, however, she is now looking to build on that capital base and progressively have her outlets become a more lucrative, sustainable business solution. This would ensure the long-term comfort and peace of mind of herself and those who depend on her, including her family as well as a large part of her community.

A huge challenge for Constance are the constant float shortages she currently experiences, especially when assisting a client who needs to send a large sum of money. This results in her losing clients to other mobile money transfer competitors and also results in her clients losing faith in her services.

On a broader spectrum, Constance would like to be able to give back to her community by not only creating employment opportunities and thus helping others achieve the same peace of mind she now currently enjoys, but also to be a viable, trustworthy alternative in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the working class. This would not only save her community member’s time, but it would also lower their expenses as this would reduce the need to travel long distances in order to send and receive money. One of her objectives is to take safe money transfer facilities to the community and clients no longer having to spend on travel would make this a reality as well as improve the overall customer experience.

Zoona has done market research and in so doing have found that the locations in which Constance is looking to open new outlets would be ideal not only for employment opportunities for those communities, but also to generate the traction she envisions for her business.

At the present time, Constance does not have the necessary capital needed to execute her vision and objective. Connecting with Kiva lenders would jump start her endeavour while simultaneously jump starting opportunities for future employees who are also looking to become entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to generate enough capital in order to expand her business even more and create many more jobs.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 41 year’s old married woman and a mother of three. Salam has always wanted to ‎provide her children with the best education. Her 19 years old daughter Malak is appearing ‎instead of Salam because she is conservative woman.

Malak is a university student majoring in ‎economics, and she is in her second year. She is seeking to pass her Bachelors’ so that she ‎will experience work life. But because of the financial crisis her family has been facing, she ‎couldn’t pay for her upcoming semester fees.

For that, Salam, as all mothers, wants to help ‎her kids to complete their education, therefore she is applying for educational loan to pay ‎for Malak`s university fees and to help her achieve her dreams.‎

loans.use: to pay for her daughter`s 2nd year BA degree course in Economics at university.

loans.name: Abdulhadi

texts.en:
Abdulhadi is maize farmer from Gidan Mai Bindiga village. As a member of Babban Gona, Abdulhadi is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulhadi would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulhadi can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Abdulhadi is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en: Yasser is 36, married and has 3 children. He has a small cattle fattening project and is requesting 10,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his sales of milk, cheese and butter.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle, to increase his sales of milk,cheese and butter

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is married and has eight grown children. She runs a sari-sari(variety) store selling various commodities like edible oil, eggs, biscuits, noodles, seasonings, shampoo, tooth paste, bath soap, powdered milk and soft drinks. She resides in the rural town of Dagohoy, Bohol.

For the past 30 years, she has owned a sari-sari(variety) store business, serving neighbors in the community where she lives.

Expedita decided to join CEVI to avail loans and boost her business. She would like to buy assorted groceries such as beverages, condiments and dry goods. These will slowly improve her income and able to set aside some of the profit for emergency use.

She is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries such as beverages, condiments and dry goods

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 58-year-old married woman with four children. Two of her children, aged 13 and 15, still attend school.

Ignacia runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling commodities like sugar, cooking oil, coffee, powdered milk, salt, eggs, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries. Eleven years ago, she started running the store, catering to locals and neighbors in her area.

Ignacia has requested a loan to buy a new refrigerator and stock of soft drinks and other beverages. She will be able to fill her store and cope with customer demand. In this way, she will be able to settle her obligation and provide for the needs of her children.

She is hoping that her sari-sari store will become productive.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and stock of soft drinks and other beverages.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en: Avelino is from Kinamandagan, Lazi, Siquijor. He is 58 years of age. He and his wife have 3 adult-age children. He joined Paglaum MPC and he appreciates the programs and services of the said co-op. From his desire to help the family, he engaged in selling fish in different barangays in municipality of Kinamandagan, Lazi, Siquijor. Only his motorcycle was used as his source of transportation to reached the different barangays and sell fish. His source of income existed for 2 years now. In need of additional working capital, he requested a financial assistance from Paglaum MPC an amount of Php 5,000.00 to purchase more stocks of fish. Through this, he hopes to increase and/or has more income for he is able to provide for the daily needs of his family and also he is happy he can support the education of his children which is his main priority of his hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish for selling

loans.name: Msani

texts.en:
As a previous Kiva borrower, Msani is looking to expand his business by being funded again. Since his first loan, Msani has managed to expand from four to ten outlets and he is looking to keep this momentum going, as this will improve his standard of living as well as that of the people he is responsible for.

Currently, Msani uses the revenue generated by his ten Zoona outlets to pay for tuition for his wife, children and siblings. Msani’s wife is studying to become a secondary school teacher, while his children are still at school. He also has a brother he is putting through high school and a sister he is putting through college.

Being able to run his own business by opening these Zoona outlets has allowed him to keep his family afloat. However, Msani is now looking to build on that capital base and progressively have his outlets become a more lucrative, sustainable business solution. This would ensure the long-term comfort and peace of mind of Msani and those who depend on him.

On a broader spectrum, Msani would like to be able to give back to his community not only by creating employment opportunities and thus helping others achieve the same peace of mind he now currently enjoys, but also by being a viable, trustworthy alternative in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the working class. Zoona has done market research and in so doing has found that the locations in which Msani is looking to open new outlets would be ideal not only for employment opportunities for those communities, but also to generate the traction he envisions for his business.

Currently, Msani does not have the necessary capital needed to execute his vision and objective. Connecting with Kiva lenders would jump-start his endeavor while simultaneously jump-starting opportunities for future employees who are also looking to become entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To raise more capital in order to open more outlets

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is a mother of two children who lives in a wooden house located in Nayagarh, Odisha, India. She is 39 years old. She is the one standing in the middle in the photograph.

Rice farming on a one-hectare area is the main source of her family’s income. She can earn additional income via working for others for a fee. She can earn about 600 INR per day, and she has been with her business for ages.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. In a group of three members, she is the leader of group. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a decent latrine for supporting her family members so that they can live a comfortable life and avoid infectious diseases.

She hopes that all her family members are healthy, and they can perform their jobs better than before to earn more income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for supporting her family members.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta is a 33 year-old married mother of three children, who works hard to support her family. She is a teacher and her husband is in agriculture. Although the family works very hard, it can be not enough for them to afford the cost of their daughter's education. This loan of $ 600 will allow Marta to help her daughters continue her study in senior high school. She will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.  In the future, Marta hopes that her children are all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university  education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Philibus

texts.en:
Philibus is a maize farmer from Barangwaje village. As a Babban Gona member, Philibus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Philibus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Philibus will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Philibus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Philibus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Paranesi

texts.en: Paranesi is a married woman of 42 years old with 7 children. She runs a small business selling pork bun in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Paranesi has requested a loan to buy a bags of flour, a baking soda, bags of chicken legs, vegetable oil, a fryer and a bag of onions. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Paranesi will expand her business and to support her family financially .

loans.use: to buy a  bags of flour, a baking soda, bags of chicken legs, vegetable oil, a fryer and a bag of onions

loans.name: Yanci Jamileth

texts.es: Yanci de 29 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia, en la cual ha habitado toda su vida. Vive al lado de su hijo de 7 años quien es su motivación y la persona que le da fuerzas día con día para esforzarse para obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para los gastos del hogar y de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades básicas de ella y de su hijo. Yanci posee un negocio de venta de frutas, platillos típicos, pan dulce y pan francés, el cual tiene 4 años de administrar y esto le permite tener una buena cantidad de personas que la prefieren para comprar sus productos. Pero en cuanto a la preparación de sus platillos típicos no cuenta con los materiales adecuados y por lo que se le dificulta a la hora de cocinar y en vista que la demanda a sus productos ha aumentado solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: un carretón para la elaboración de los platillos y mesas con sillas para ofrecerle una mejor atención a sus clientes, mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Yanci is 29 years old, lives in her own home where she has lived all her life. She lives with her son who is 7 years old, he is her motivation and the person who gives her the strength every day to make an effort to obtain the necessary income for the household and to support the basic needs for her and her son.

Yanci has a business selling fruit, traditional meals, sweet and french bread. She has been in this business for 4 years and this has earned her a good amount of customers who prefer buying her products. However, she does not have the proper materials to prepare the traditional meals and this makes it difficult when preparing and cooking the meals. Due to the demand of her products she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: a cart to prepare meals, tables and chairs to offer a better service to her customers, improve her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to invest in:  a cart to prepare meals, tables and chairs to improve her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, who is in her mid-twenties, is married with one child, who is still in school. She has been running a retail shop for celery for three years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Judith's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy rice, maize, beans, flour, and similar goods for her retail shop. She use her profits for school fees and covering household expenses. She dreams of expanding her business. She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize, beans, flour, and similar goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas, papayas, oranges, tomatoes, cabbages, chili peppers, and carrots, among other fruits and vegetables, to expand her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a poultry farm where she keeps chickens and has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Christine will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more chickens. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will generate more income. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 58 years old woman and has four children, three of whom are adults and one of whom attends school. She is from Clarin, Bohol. She is working alone since her husband had already passed away.

To earn a living and to provide for the needs of her family, Gloria operates a food selling business. She sells food such as “puto,” a Filipino steamed rice cake, to the community, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns about 2,000 PHP per month.

Gloria requested a loan, which she will use to buy food ingredients such as cooking oil, coconut milk, glutinous rice, flour, and sugar. In the future, she wishes to improve her business because it is her main source of income.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, coconut milk, glutinous rice, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
According to Analee, 37, managing a variety store is not as easy as other people perceive. She wakes up very early in the morning and goes to sleep late at night because some customers buy as early as 4:30am or as late as 11:30pm. She has to meet their needs so they won’t brand her as unfriendly. It’s a good thing that her husband, Marvin, takes a turn at looking after her store when he’s not on duty as a collector.

To enhance the competitiveness of her store within her community, Analee also sells rice and retails cellphone load. Rice is a staple food and is always in demand, while load retailing meets the needs of prepaid cellphone holders. She has to be creative and resourceful in order to save for her young children’s education. One of her techniques is to give her debtors a maximum of one week to pay their debts so she can roll her capital. But still, many of them can’t meet her deadline because of financial difficulty. As a result, her capital decreases, which is why she needs PHP 20,000 additional capital. This amount will help cover her receivables and she can buy more sacks of rice, assorted groceries and beverages.

Analee is a faithful member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Digos, Davao Del Sur branch. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more sacks of rice, assorted groceries and beverages

loans.name: Adijha

texts.en:
Adijha, 59, is a widow who looks after her three grandchildren. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

She deals in cocoa farming and selling to cocoa dealers, and she earns additional income from selling cosmetics and lace, mainly to her lady customers in town. She started the business to raise income for her family.

She has a challenge of limited capital to invest in the cocoa business during the peak season, as well as seasonal changes. She hopes to expand her business and construct rental houses in the future to generate income. Her previous loan was used to buy more cocoa for selling and she manages her finances very well, since she has been in business for the last 17 years. She is now requesting a loan to pay school fees for her four children in secondary school.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her four children in secondary school.

loans.name: Pinki's Group

texts.en:
Being a vegetable vendor, Pinki, who is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, two of them married, can only make 300 INR per day to support her family. Pinki resides in a rural area of Nayagarh District, Odisha, India. She has been involved in this career for nearly 15 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Pinki along with her other group members would like to get a Kiva-funded loan of 45,000 INR from Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount in order to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards.

She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her. She is the one standing to the middle of the photograph.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house.

loans.name: Ramamani's Group

texts.en:
Ramamani, is a humble woman, standing in the middle of the photograph in a orange saree. She currently lives with her husband in Nayagarh district, Odisha, India. Her family’s main income is from the married couple’s small piece of paddy land so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount.

She wants to build a sanitation facility for her house but she does not have enough money to buy materials. Therefore, along with her group members, she is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR for this purpose.

She very much hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a clean sanitation facility, which will make them feel more convenient and comfortable. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan.

loans.use: to build a sanitation facility for her house.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan lives with his parents in the north of Jordan. He is an example of an ambitious and ‎positive guy. Marwan is 23 years old, a university student majoring in Management Information ‎Systems.
‎
He wishes to graduate to find good work to help his parents with the household expenses and ‎to carry responsible from them. Lately his father faced financial problems and he could not ‎cover Marwan`s university fees. Therefore he decided to apply for an educational loan to pay ‎for his university fees and achieve his goals.‎

loans.use: to pay ‎for his university fees for a BSc. in Management Information Systems and achieve his goals.‎.

loans.name: Mema

texts.en: Mema is a divorced woman of 38 years old with 3 children. She runs a small business selling pork buns and chips in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Mema has requested a loan to buy a pot, fryer, bags of flour, sack of chicken and a vegetable oil. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mema will use her profit to support her family financially and to save for unexpected.

loans.use: to buy a pot, fryer, bags of flour, sack of chicken and a vegetable oil

loans.name: Gs Montefresco Group

texts.en:
Tomasa is 65 years old and is a mother of two. She lives with her spouse in the community of Trojes, Honduras. Her principal occupation is the cultivation of coffee.

This year, Tomasa is expecting good coffee production because it's a new crop. She has 25 years of experience in the management of this type of work, and she also has dairy cows. Her farm is located in the small village of Buena Esperanza.

Tomasa's dream is to improve her family's living conditions. With the loan she's requesting, she will be able to obtain solar energy equipment. This is a dream she has had for a while now, and which will become a reality with the support of Microfinanciera Prisma of Honduras and Kiva.

The other members work in coffee production and plantain production. They include Gregorio and Jacinto, and they too share Tomasa's dream of having light in their homes.

Trojes, Honduras
August 2015

loans.use: to purchase solar energy equipment for their home.

loans.name: Serengeti Group

texts.en:
Lilian is in her mid-thirties and single with one kid who is still in school. She has been a food vendor for ten years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Lilian's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her mamalishe stock and has repaid her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Lilian will share this loan this loan with her loan group Serengeti, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Raising eight children is quite challenging but here is Lolita, she doesn’t focus on difficulties, instead she considers her big family as companions through triumphs and trials. She is married to Cristomo, a retailer, who gives all out support in raising their eight children. 

Lolita is running this general store in Davao City. The stiff competition in this line of business pushes her to innovate. She adds vegetables and dried fish to her inventory. Not only this, she also combines cleaning materials such as brooms and sponges. In this way, she can boost her income to provide for their daily expenditures and educational costs of her children. Among her eight children, six are still studying. The older two are already working and capable of extending financial help to them. 

The combined income from her business, her husband and her two children is still insufficient for the huge educational expenses. This is why Lolita longs to improve her business by adding frozen foods and sacks of rice. Part of the loan will be allotted for the usual supplies such as groceries and beverages. A loan worth PHP 50,000 would be very helpful.  

Lolita wants to see all her children finish their schooling to gain better opportunities for decent wage. She prays for good health and a more comfortable life someday. She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase frozen foods, sacks of rice, groceries and beverages

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leah dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнара, 42 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Гульнары- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она 25 лет занимается животноводством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы. Также занимается садоводством, выращивая фрукты для собственного потребления. Гульнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulnara is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Gulnara has a secondary education. She has been rearing animals for 25 years as teh main income for her family. Today she has two cows. She also grows crops, growing fruits for her own consumption. Gulnara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy three heifers to increase the size of her herd. Gulnara plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a fifty seven year old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has seven children of whom four attend school. He rears cattle alongside crop growing as a side income project and works all days in the week, given the nature of what he does.

He has been rearing cattle for more than fourteen years and says he has been able to earn a living and do some home developments. Francis intends to be a modern commercial farmer but his major challenge is inadequate capital and high inflation rates.
He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening in his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening on his farm.

loans.name: Gadson

texts.en:
Gadson is a hardworking married man with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. All his children attend school and the whole responsibility of caring for them entirely rests on him.

He still deals in produce as his main source of income and sells coffee, maize and also does farming as a side source of income. He has been a farmer for more than 12 years and works six days in a week. He hopes to expand his business to a bigger store, become rich, have a modernized farm and establish another business however his main challenges are high inflation rates and inadequate capital.

He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee and maize for his produce shop.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and maize for his produce shop.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is responsible mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 18 years. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis.

Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Shaheen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Shaheen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Shaheen also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Shaheen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing taxi

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 32 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and 1 child. She is providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Việt's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Việt is 40 years old, and she is married with two children. She has been operating a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Việt lives in Quang Xuong District, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region, and the income from this business is unstable because the supply and the price of fish rely on the weather conditions.

The main hardship that Việt faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. This is Việt's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Her group consists of four members. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard.

In the future, Việt hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Ayubhoja

texts.en: Ayubhoja is a kind man. He was born in 1967 year. Ayubhoja is divorced and has a son. He works in a primary transport organization during 6 years. He is very hardworking and industrious man. So, his colleagues like him much. Ayubhoja lives with his mother. He has a small salary and that’s why they live poorly. Now Ayubhoja is ill and he must to buy medicines for his treatment. He is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni with this aim. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his treatment .

loans.name: Hoan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoan is 57 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fish for 5 years. Hoan lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in a village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable because the amount and the price of fish depend on the weather conditions.

The main hardship that Hoan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish so she can raise her income each month.

In 2011, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hoan has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Her group consists of three members. In the future, Hoan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to raise her income each month.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene is 33 years old, married and had two children. She is involved into direct-selling business and had been in her business for about three years now. Mylene hopes to acquire more profits in her business to sustain needs of her family. She is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy perfumes, colognes, soap and cosmetics to sell. She hopes to improve her sales and gets good income used as emergency funds.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, colognes, soap and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Lallaine

texts.en:
Hog raising combined with chicken and duck raising are practical endeavors that will surely alleviate food shortage in the community. Lallaine has been in this business for 25 years already, and she’s convinced that it is such a profitable enterprise that offers affordable food. Her income from this business helps sustain their daily needs and the education of her children. Despite many challenges like tiring tasks and limited capital, she remains strong with motivation to further improve her business and become successful. She lives in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental together with her husband, Edgardo, and their three children. 

Now that Lallaine aims to distribute bigger volume of affordable meat within the community, she wants to buy additional piglets, chicks and ducklings that she can raise. Along with these, she needs to buy sacks of feed, vitamins and medicines. She would like to ask for PHP 30,000 loan for this purpose. Later on she plans to renovate the roofing of her pen to better protect the livestock.
 
She shares her experiences and aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories and reflect on the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, chicks and ducklings; plus sacks of feed, vitamins and medicines

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a previous Kiva lender, Mercy is looking to expand her business by being funded again.

Since her first loan, Mercy has managed to expand from one to two outlets and she is looking to keep this momentum going as this will improve her standard of living as well as that of the people she is responsible for.
Currently, Mercy uses the revenue generated by her two Zoona outlets to pay for tuition for her siblings who are both tertiary level students. Mercy would also like to further her own education and she requires more revenue in order to make this a reality.

Currently, Mercy holds a qualification in Information systems and accountancy. Her dream is to take this further and empower herself and plough that knowledge back into running her Zoona outlets to be a role model for other young women in her community.

Being able to run her own business by having been able to open these Zoona outlets has allowed Mercy to keep her family afloat, however, she is now looking to build on that capital base and progressively have her outlets become a more lucrative, sustainable business solution. This would ensure the long-term comfort and peace of mind of herself and those who depend on her.

On a broader spectrum, Mercy would like to be able to give back to her community by not only creating employment opportunities and thus helping others achieve the same peace of mind she now currently enjoys, but also to be a viable, trustworthy alternative in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the working class. This would not only save her community member’s time, but it would also lower their expenses as this would reduce the need to travel long distances in order to send and receive money.
Zoona has done market research and in so doing have found that the locations in which Mercy is looking to open new outlets would be ideal not only for employment opportunities for those communities, but also to generate the traction she envisions for his business.

At the present time, Mercy does not have the necessary capital needed to execute her vision and objective. Connecting with Kiva lenders would jump start her endeavour while simultaneously jump starting opportunities for future employees who are also looking to become entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to generate enough capital to expand her business into more locations and create more employment oportunties

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 29 year old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transport business where he works for 12 hours and has been in this business for 5 years now having started it with a hope of employing himself and earning more income for his family. He is faced with challenges of bad weather that make roads impassable and spoil tyres leading him to constant expenses on motorcycle repair. However, he is looking forward to buying another car to start a taxi transport business. Joseph has asked for a loan to buy chicken for rearing.

loans.use: to buy chickens for rearing.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is maize farmer from Ba'awa village. As a member of Babban Gona, Isah is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Isah would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Isah is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bimala's Group

texts.en:
Bimala is a 38-year-old widowed woman, standing to the left hand side in the photograph. She has been making embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. She hails from a small village of Nayagarh district, Odisha, India.

To cherish her children and to meet household expenses, she started embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her all raw materials for making embroidery. She completes her tasks, along with her daughter, over wooden frames.

She wants to sell embroidery directly in the market so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her arts and wants to buy raw material of her own so that she can sell her handmade embroidery.

Therefore, Bimala along with her group member, has requested a Kiva loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can embroider more dresses to sell and generate maximum income.

She is a mother of three sons and a daughter. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can embroider more dresses to sell.

loans.name: Usman Luka

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Usman has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Usman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Usman can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Usman will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Usman is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nawale

texts.en: Nawale is a 47-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her six children; three of them are still studying. She is a housewife and her husband represents the main income source to be able to enhance their way of living and she received also assistance from her children. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 30 years old and has eight children. Annabelle is married and has six children who are in school.

Annabelle is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Annabelle has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Luis Ángel

texts.es: Luis es un microempresario de 26 años, habitante del municipio de Barranquilla y en esta localidad emprendió su proyecto de negocio en el año 2014. Él llegó a este municipio hace cinco años proveniente de Uribia un municipio de la Guajira y comenzó a laborar como plomero en una firma  constructora, con el pasar de los años su anhelo de ser empresario independiente se fue incrementando y vio oportunidad de negocio desde su vivienda al ofrecer a la comunidad servicio de llamadas a todos los operadores nacionales y cervezas. Hoy en día brinda bienestar a su cónyuge y a su hijo de apenas un año de edad con los frutos de su negocio, en el que labora diariamente a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.  Con la finalidad de ampliar su variedad de productos aplicó a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en refrescos; jugos naturales, gaseosas, pony maltas y cervezas con las que pretende incrementar sus ventas.  Su meta familiar es comprar su propia vivienda para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a 26 year-old small businessman who resides in the city of Barranquilla.  This is where he launched his business in 2014.  He arrived here 5 years ago, coming from Uribia, a town in La Guajira, and he started to work as a plumber for a construction company.  Over the years, his desire to become an independent businessman grew, and he saw the opportunity sell from his home.  He provides long distance domestic phone call services and also sells beer.

Today, he provides for the welfare of his wife and child, who is barely a year old, with the earnings from his business.  He works there daily from 8am until 6pm.  With the goal of expanding the variety of products he sells, he has applied for a loan.  This is his first Kiva loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the funds to buy drinks, natural juices, soft drinks, pony malts, and beer to increase his sales.  His goal for his family is to buy his own house so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is 20 years old, single and lives in a sector of Jordan called Al Hashmi. She is a student at ‎university majoring in Accounting.‎
