Farah has a lot of dreams to achieve after she graduates, but her father cannot help her to ‎cover her education fees, therefore she asked for an education loan to help her cover her ‎university fees.‎

loans.use: to help her cover her ‎university fees to graduate with a BA in Accounting

loans.name: Bharathi's Group

texts.en:
Being a farmer on the rice field, Bharathi, who is a 27-year-old married woman with two children who are enrolled in the local primary school, can only make 200 INR per day to support her family. Bharathi resides in a rural area of Nayagarh District, Odisha, India. She has been involved in this career for nearly eight years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Bharathi would like to get a loan of 45,000 INR, along with her other group members, from Kiva via People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount in order to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, environment, and living standards.

She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

The lady standing to the extreme left in the photograph is Bharathi.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house.

loans.name: Hamaspyur

texts.en:
Hamaspyur is a farmer living in Lanjazat village of the Ararat region with her husband and a son. Her younger son serves in the army and he is 19-years-old. Hamaspyur and her family have been involved in farming for 12 years. Their farm includes livestock (2 sows, hens, 4 turkeys and 2 cows) and also a fruit orchard where peach trees and strawberries are growing.

Besides selling the harvest at local markets, the family has income from Hamaspyur's husband's work as an auto repairman. They all works hard to sustain their living costs and have appropriate living conditions. Hamaspyur asks this loan to purchase four oxen and forage for feeding the livestock to prepare her farm for the cold and severe winter season.

loans.use: to pay for four oxen and forage for feeding the livestock to prepare the farm for winter season and receive income for family's living

loans.name: Samuela

texts.en:
Samuela Lives in Same and she is a business woman. She is applying for a loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent, salt, soap, noodles, candy, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

Samuela started to open her business in 2006 with her working capital of $ 500.00. She is earning a good income every day, so very happy to do her business. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes to get a good management for her business. She also has animals like cows, pigs, chickens.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies to keep in her store such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent, salt, soap, noodles, candy, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is 42 years old with three children and he lives in one of the underprivileged areas in ‎Jordan called Baqaa. He has his own business repairing cars and works all day long as the ‎main source of income for his family. He has a lot of customers, which helps him to be able ‎to earn a good salary to provide for his family.
‎
He is asking for a loan in order to renovate his workshop and buy new equipment. He hopes ‎that this loan will help him to be able to continue his work and wants to thank all of the ‎lenders.‎

loans.use: to renovate his car repair workshop and buy new equipment.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Murtala has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Murtala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Murtala can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Murtala will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Murtala is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Las Reinas 4 Group

texts.en:
Rosanny is the coordinator of her group, Las Reinas (Queens) 4. Her story is representative of both her group members and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently moved from the Haiti to the DR) clients. Her group is based in the Santo Domingo Norte, where most of the people who live in this part of the capital are citizens with many needs.

Here she makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and a child. Rosanny is excited to take her second loan from Esperanza.

She plans to use this loan to improve her small general store, where she will add drinking products by buying a freezer with this investments and some miscellaneous products she will increase her sells. Rosanny says she enjoys doing business. Her most important dream is to have a successful business to produce enough income to have a tranquil life along with her family.

She will continuing saving and re-investing her business profits. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy used clothes to resell, jewelry, beauty products and a freezer.

loans.name: Xoan's Group

texts.en:
Xoan is 55 years old and married with 2 children. She has been working in agriculture raising pigs for more than 10 years. 

Xoan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region and the income from this business is unstable because when a pig disease happens, they could die, which leaves her with nothing to sell and she would be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Xoan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. This is Xoan's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard. Her group consists of three members.

In the future, Xoan hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Lode

texts.en:
Lode, 51, owns and operates a sari-sari store. She sells merchandise like chips, biscuits, candies, edible oil, shampoo, fabric conditioner, eggs, sugar, soft drinks and beverages.
She has her own property where she lives with her 19-year old daughter and husband and she is happy to have her family.

Lode wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI, to buy supplies like drinks, groceries and toiletries. These will help her attract more buyers and improve her income slowly.

She used the previous loan to stock her sari-sari(variety) store and wants to continue doing so.

loans.use: to buy supplies like drinks, groceries and toiletries

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Alona works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Alona is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Alona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 57 years old, married and has three children.  

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Estrelita requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Estrelita has been raising pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Estrelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is a 42-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosanna has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosanna has been raising pigs for 15 years, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosanna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ernie

texts.en:
Ernie, 38, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ernie has a furniture business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Ernie requested a 50,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her furniture making business such as paints, wood, etc.. 

In the future, Ernie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her furniture making business such as paints, wood, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 36 years old with two children, ages 13 and 2 years old. Together with her husband she operates their small grocery (sari-sari store) business. They have been in this business for eight years and been SEED partners for six years.

The store has been their only source of income for their basic needs since her husband has been laid off from his work. With the separation pay together with the additional capital from loan, they started their store with just the basic items like canned goods, noodles, soaps, coffee and sugar.

With hard work and perseverance their sari-sari store today has more items in it and more regular customers too. They also added shelves to accommodate and display their groceries, and they were able to renovate their house adding a new roof, and all of this is from the revenue of their income.

Milagros is still working hard to improve her business, she is requesting a loan amount of PHP 30,000 to buy five sacks of rice, three boxes of canned goods, bottle goods, noodles and other additional groceries items to sell in her store.
The holidays are fast approaching, and they wanted to take the opportunity to increase their income and save up more.

Milagros is also plan to put up a piso net (computer rental) in the future as additional income. She is working hard just to provide for her family, and also she is working hard for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of rice, three boxes of canned goods, bottle goods, noodles and other additional groceries items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Loubna

texts.en: Loubna is a 43 year old married woman living with her husband and mother of two children. Her husband is the main income source in the family, he is a retired soldier and works also in car trading as for her, and she is a housewife taking care of her family. Due to the hard financial circumstances and with the aim to help her children with their education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay their school educational fees. Her only dream is to ensure them a heavy life and helped them to achieve high educational levels and being always able to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to pay her children's school educational fees

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a married woman with two children, who describes herself as patient.

She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops, and also keeps dairy cows. Lydiah has been involved in this business for four years. Her farm is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are locals.

Lydiah describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. Her goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

This is Lydiah's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid previous loans. Lydiah will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married, 46-year-old woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gina has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business, such as paint, wood, etc.

Gina has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her furniture making business, such as paint, wood, etc.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 55 years old and is married with one child. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, sugar, shampoo, and other groceries.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en:
This is Mesrop's second loan with Kiva. With great repayment history behind him, Mesrop asks this second loan again for investing in his business as a retailer. Due to his hard work, and with the help of his previous loan, Mesrop became only official distributor of one of the armenian sweet factories in Lori region. He also got married and currently his family members are 4: his parents, sister and his wife. 
Mesrop hopes to receive lenders' support one more time and continue his business in his local Vanadzor town of Lori region,

loans.use: to pay for new stock of supplies (candies, sweets, cookies) for reselling

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
Sevak is from Noratus village of Gavar region where he lives with his parents, brother, wife and two little kids. Last year, Sevak started his retail business: he trades in crayfish. Mostly, he purchases crayfish from his fishermen co-villagers and sells them to restaurants and pubs. 

Sevak works hard to sustain his business and at the same time cover his family's living costs. The requested loan is important for him to purchase a new stock of crayfish to sell so he will be able to gather income for his big family. Sevak hopes that extra income from this loan will help him improve his family status and increase his business level.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of crayfish to sell, so he will be able to gather income for his big family

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is married with children. He operates a retail shop and also farms for extra income. By doing this, he has been able to meet his family demands without fail. Steven's shop is lacking enough stock to sell and display in order to attract many customers, and he would like to add stock for his income level to improve. He is requesting a loan facility to buy soap, pampers and flour among others to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, pampers and flour among others to sell.

loans.name: Kalia's Group

texts.en:
Kalia belongs to Nayagarh, in Odisha, India. She is a 40-year-old lady who works as a daily wage labourer in the agricultural sector. She has five members in her family, including three children. Her monthly savings are only INR 1,150, and the monthly medical expenses are around INR 500. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity.

Kalia’s family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

Joining hands with two other members, whose families face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, she has formed a group of three members and is hoping to address this issue. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Kalia, her group members, and their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of INR 45,000 to build a toilet at home.

As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access with improved hygiene and a better way of life.

Kalia is standing in the middle in the photograph.

loans.use: to build a safe and hygienic toilet in her home.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 38 years old and a responsible mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own auto workshop business for the past 10 years. Shakeela's husband needs to purchase tools and machinery for his business, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise. To fulfill the need of her husband, Shakeela has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With this loan she will help her husband to buy the items needed for his business. This will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Shakeela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools and machinery for her husband's auto workshop

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Abubakar now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Asmi

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Asmi, who is a 47-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. Asmi and her husband have been selling meatballs for ten years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Asmi will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Con 26 años de edad, Juan vive al lado de su compañera de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia, en la cual ha habitado toda su vida. Juan para mantener la economía del hogar y de esta manera darle una mejor forma de vida a su hijo presta sus servicios en una empresa cercana a su vivienda. Gracias a esto puede satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. Así también Juan desea mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, polines, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para construir una bodega en su vivienda, de esta manera poder resguardar de una mejor manera sus propiedades y mover algunas cosas de su vivienda para poder tener más espacio. También Juan se siente muy agradecido con el crédito anterior, ya que gracias a ello pudo invertir en la mejoría de su vivienda, colocando ladrillo de piso para poder ofrecerle un mejor entorno a su hijo.
texts.en:
Juan is 26 years old and lives with his partner and their 3 year old son in their own home where he has lived all his life. To support the household expenses and to provide better living conditions for his son, he works for a company that is located close to his home. Thanks to this, he can cover the basic needs of his family. At the same time, Juan would like to improve their quality of life.

He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: laminated sheeting, beams, cement, sand and to pay for labor to build a storage area in his house to better protect his property and store some of the things from his house and have more space.

Juan is thankful for the previous loan he received which helped him invest and improve his home by paving the floor with bricks and that way, offer a better environment for his son.

loans.use: to invest in: laminated sheeting, beams, cement, sand and to pay for labor to build a storage room in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy necessary materials.

loans.name: Mariqueta

texts.en:
Mariqueta is a hard-working woman who earns a living through raising hogs.  For almost 20 years now, she has been engaged in hog-raising as a livelihood. She is seeking ways to improve her quality of life, so she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling commodities like sugar, condiments, powdered milk, eggs, shampoo, bath soap and dry goods.

Mariqueta is a married woman with three grown children. Her husband is a carpenter. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

Mariqueta has requested a loan to buy two piglets and assorted groceries for the store. Her goal is to increase her livestock and also fill her store with a variety of merchandise to attract more buyers. She hopes to improve her financial income. 

With her previous loan, Mariqueta managed to invest in hogs to sell, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and assorted groceries for the store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be God-fearing, strong and a go getter. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transport costs. Susan will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ma. Racil

texts.en:
Ma. Racil is 49 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Ma. Racil works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Racil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. Ma. Racil has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Ma. Racil would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine and her husband (in the photo) live in Lanjar village of Ararat region with their four children ranging in age from 3 to 16 years old, with three of them currently attending school. 

Armine and her husband have run their mixed farm for over 5 years, and sell the variety of products at the local market. Armine's family's primary income comes from the sale of milk, cereals, chickens, meat, wheat, barley and emmer wheat. The requested loan will greatly help this nice couple to purchase a sow and two oxen, forage for feeding the livestock, fertilizer, and seeds for land cultivation in order for their farm to function well in the winter season. 

Armine and her husband hope to receive lenders' support. They hope that extra income from this loan will help them to pay school fees for their children and will allow them to provide proper nutrition for the family.

loans.use: to pay for a sow and two oxen, forage for feeding the livestock, fertilizer, and seeds for land cultivation

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is applying for this loan because she wants to buy apple seeds to plant. She is pictured with her only grandson in the photograph (standing in front of a store in the village where she had gone to buy groceries and where the loan officer met her).

She is 47 years old and a married mother of two children. Her oldest child is married and lives with Meri and her husband. For the past 15 years, she has been involved in agriculture to earn a living. On her agricultural land, she has planted plum and apple orchards, grapevines, and large quantities of seasonal crops, such as potatoes and red onions. Meri sells the products to wholesale buyers / sellers. Her husband and son work in a nearby cafe.

loans.use: to buy apple seeds to plant her orchards.

loans.name: Friendly Group

texts.en:
Hòa is 34 years old and is married with three children. She lives in the Hau Loc district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village (and the market need is low in this region).

For five years, she has had a retail business selling dry food and general things. The main hardship that Hòa faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

In 2014, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, and her group consists of 5 members. In the future, Hòa hopes that her business does well, that her family is healthy and happy, and that her children do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis es un microempresario de 53 años de edad, habitante en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Bogotá en donde reside con su familia, él cuenta con una amplia trayectoria en el negocio de la ebanistería puesto que aprendió este arte empíricamente a sus 18 años de edad, cuando se empleó como ayudante en un taller de carpintería en donde tuvo la  oportunidad de participar en el proceso productivo y aprender técnicas para cortar, pegar, pulir y armar. Con el paso del tiempo estuvo empleado en otros talleres y posteriormente aperturó su propio taller en el año de 1995, consolidase como un taller reconocido en la capital del país que cuenta con veinte años de servicio ofreciendo muebles con excelentes acabados, servicio de tapicería y restauración de muebles.   En la actualidad aplicó a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir una sierra eléctrica y un cepillo, herramientas que le proporcionaran agilidad y una mayor capacidad de producción.  Con esta inversión su negocio será mucho más competitivo y podrá continuar con cancelando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis is 53 years old and a small-time entrepreneur. He lives in one of the barrios of Bogotá with his family. He has been working at his carpentry business for quite some time, having learned the trade on the job when he was 18 years old. At the time he was working in another carpentry workshop where he had the opportunity to be a part of the production process and to learn techniques to cut and glue wood, and to polish it and assemble products.

As time went one, Luis worked in other workshops and later opened his own in 1995. The workshop became well-known here in Colombia's capital, and now has been selling great furniture for 20 years, as well as providing carpeting services and furniture restoration .

Luis is currently applying for a loan, his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy an electric saw and a brush, tools that improve his skills and increase production capacity.

With this investment, Luis' business will be much more competitive and Luis will be able to continue paying off his house.

loans.use: to buy an electric saw and a brush.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina es una emprendedora mujer de 50 años que al encontrarse en una situación de desempleo después de haber laborado en el sector comercial, decidió buscar nuevos horizontes y a pesar de su difícil situación se inscribió en una academia para tomar clases de patronaje, corte y confección, de este modo logró adquirir el conocimiento para emprender su taller, sin embargo ella consideró que deseaba confeccionar a gran escala y tomó clases en una institución del estado de manejo de máquinas industriales. En la actualidad confecciona a mayoristas de la ciudad de Bogotá que es también su lugar de residencia y realiza todo el proceso productivo; corte, armado, costura y acabados, por lo que su proyecto de negocio es iniciar su propia marca de ropa y para ello está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en insumos y materias primas para cumplir con su sueño de prosperidad.  Su meta a futuro es comprar un vehículo para el trabajo y garantizar agilidad.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is an entrepreneur. She is 50 years old.

When she became unemployed, Luz Marina decided to search for new horizons and, in spite of her difficult situation, she signed up for classes in pattern designing and dressmaking. She thus gained the knowledge required to open her own workshop. However, Luz Marina wanted to make products in high volume and so took classes in operating industrial equipment at a state institution. She now produces in bulk for wholesalers in Bogotá, where she lives. Luz Marina makes the products from start to finish - from cutting the material, putting the clothes together, sewing them up and putting on the finishing touches.

Luz Marina's plan is to create her own brand of clothes. She is applying for a loan, her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy supplies and materials and achieve her dream of being prosperous.

Luz Marina's future goal is to buy a vehicle for her business and to be more agile.

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials and achieve her dream of being prosperous.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is single mother of two children living in the town of Kasese, which lies across the equator in Uganda. After having failed relationships, Resty decided to concentrate on raising her children alone and has had to work very hard to ensure that her children have all the basics. She operates a retail shop where she sells items such as  flour, Pampers and sugar among others things and she is happy that the demand is quite high. With the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and buy land where she is currently practicing subsistence farming. Her personal goal is to offer the best education to her children, while her business dream is to own a wholesale shop. Resty is requesting a loan to buy flour, Pampers and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy flour, Pampers and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is married and she has very high interest in doing business. She got involved in business activities a few years ago with her own working capital, but she has no good management for her business. Now she has a small store so she is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital because her capital is not enough. She will used this loan to add additional items in her store including sugar, slippers, cooking oils, noodles, detergents, biscuits, tea, soft drinks and other things to sell. With this loan Elisa still wants to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, slippers, cooking oils, noodles, detergents, biscuits, tea, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Munaza

texts.en: Munaza is a 24-year-old woman, who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband has been running a general store for the past 30 years, and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family.  Munaza's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities (e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items) to sell in his store.  However, due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of the products listed above.  As a result, Munaza has applied for a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner.  This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities and will help him maximize his income for his business and household.  Munaza is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy her husband more commodities for his general store.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
Dilrabo is a very kind woman. She was born in 1990 in Tajikistan. Dilrabo is a married parent of 2 children. She is a very responsible woman and always tries to offer a good living standard for her children. Dilrabo is a teacher. She teaches the Uzbek language. Dilrabo likes her job much and she tries to develop her knowledge and skills. 

Dilrabo needs financial support because her mother is ill. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of her mother. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of her mother

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Doña Lucila de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos nietas de 13 y 2 años de edad, la clienta posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años e inicio con capital propio, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio y ase es como han podido salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para comprar mayor inventario como: golosinas, sopas, macarrones, papel de baño, detergente, etc. y asi surtir su negocio para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Lucila is 64 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her husband and two granddaughters, ages 13 and 2 years old.

Lucila has had a small shop in her home for a number of years. She started the business with her own capital. Her husband helps with the business and together they have moved forward.

Lucila is applying for a loan in order to buy more stock, such as sweets, soups, macarons, lavatory paper, detergent and other items. She can thus stock up her shop and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as sweets, soups, macarons, lavatory paper, detergent and other items.

loans.name: Maria Marcelina

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad vive sola en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 30 años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor ya que le ha ido muy bien en las ventas por esa razon solicita dicho credito y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old and lives alone in a house that she owns.

María makes a living selling fruits and vegetables for 30 years. She sells her products as a street vendor in the different local areas. With income from sales, she is able to move forward.

María is applying for another loan in order to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk. Sales have been very good, which is why she is applying for this loan. She can earn a higher income with this loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Cathalina

texts.en:
Cathalina is 54 years old and widowed with one child in school. Cathalina works very hard to provide for them.

Cathalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, coffee, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. Cathalina has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Cathalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, coffee, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Elikad

texts.en:
Elikad is a hardworking married man with six children. He handles a retail shop shop where he sells mostly clothes.

He started this business ten years ago due to the fact that his family's living conditions were poor where they were living in a rented house. With the proceeds, he was able to construct a permanent house for his family. He also needed to boost his income and educate his offspring to higher levels.

His business is doing well, though it is limited by inadequate capital for adding stock since his money sometimes lies in debts, but he hopes to one day own a wholesale shop.

Elikad hopes to use the requested loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Catalina

texts.es: Sandra de 32 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia, vive al lado de su hijo de 9 años y su hija de 5 años de edad. Sandra es madre soltera por lo cual ella es la única que mantiene la economía del hogar, esto lo logra gracias a un negocio que mantiene de venta de tortillas y pupusas, además tiene una pequeña tienda con productos básicos del hogar. Estos negocios tiene ya varios años de administrar en su vivienda  y por lo que ya cuenta con una cantidad bastante grande de clientes. La demanda ha aumentado y por lo que se requiere de más productos para logra cubrir las demandas de los clientes, por lo que Sandra solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, frijol, quesillo, chicharrón para aumentar la producción de tortillas y pupusas, además productos para surtir su tienda y ofrecer más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Sandra, aged 32, lives in her own house with her 9-year-old son and her 5-year-old daughter.

Since Sandra is a single mother, she is the only one who covers the household expenses, a task that she fulfills thanks to her two businesses: a tortilla and "pupusas" (stuffed corn-tortillas) stand, and a small grocery store.

She has been running these businesses from her home for many years now and has built a large customer base. The demand for her products has increased, and to meet her customers' needs, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy corn, beans, curd cheese, and pork cracklings to increase the production of tortillas and "pupusas"; and to buy other products to stock up her grocery store and offer her customers a wider range of products.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, curd cheese, and pork cracklings to increase the sales of her tortillas and pupusas; and to buy other products to stock up her grocery store.

loans.name: Luema

texts.en:
Luema is 38 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Luema works very hard to provide for them.

Luema runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries. Luema has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Luema would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He lives in his own home with his wife, children and four other relatives. He deals in crop farming and works all days of the week especially in his side business of buying and selling dry maize and coffee. He has dealt in farming and produce business for over eight years just working with the community around him in order to earn a living and develop himself.

David’s vision is to be a modern commercial farmer with enough and prominent businesses serving his community but he is limited by bad weather changes and inadequate capital to maintain his business to a desired standard.
David seeks a loan to buy more produce like bags of coffee, maize and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce like bags of coffee, maize and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 46 years old and married with seven children.

Adelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Adelina has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Adelina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Joselin

texts.en:
Joselin, a single mother of eight children, is an inspiring woman who decided not to let her challenges drown her in sorrows. Instead, they made her more bold and determined to have a better life. She is the sole provider for her family and is proud of her achievements.

She sells clothes as her major source of income and is very good at predicting the seasonality of her business. Her customers are very loyal and fond of her, and she says fashion has always been her childhood passion.

Inadequate capital to meet the demand and high taxes limit her progress to having a bigger business, while her dream is to set up a boutique on one of the major streets of Kasese. Joselin intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Felizia

texts.en: Felizia is requesting a loan of $ 800.00 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent, salt, soap, noodles, candy, soft drinks, hard drinks  and other things to sell including  flour to make fry banana. Felizia started to open her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $ 500.00. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent, salt, soap, noodles, candy, soft drinks, hard drinks  and other things to sell including  flour to make fried bananas.

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан, 43 года, замужем, есть 3 детей. Образование-среднее. С 1994 года Анаркан занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 20 овец. На 2,0 Га земли она выращивает рис и клевер. Ежемесячная прибыль Анаркан составляет около 23,000 сом (KGS). Она решила развить свою сельскохозяйственную деятельность, и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и перестройку сарая для скота. Анаркан доходы от бизнеса будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства.
texts.en: Anarkan is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. Anarkan has been rearing animals and growing crops since 1994. She has six cows and 20 sheep. She grows rice and clover on 2.0 hectares of land. Anarkan's monthly profit is about 23,000 som (KGS). She has decided to develop her farming activity, and has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows and to rebuild her livestock barn. Anarkan will invest the income from the business in the further development of the farm.

loans.use: to buy two cows to increase her herd and to rebuild her livestock barn.

loans.name: Sonik

texts.en:
Sonik is farmer from Aygestan village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. 

One important source of this family's income, for many years, has been a farming business. Sonik cultivates tomatoes, and grows apple, peach and quince trees. Sonik and her husband sell a wide variety of products at the local markets and gather income for their family's well-being. 

The requested loan will help Sonik to pay for renovation of the barn and prepare the water irrigation system for the farm for winter season in order to continue gathering income for her family. This investment will greatly improve the farm and will allow Sonik to increase the number of livestock in the future.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn and to prepare the water irrigation system for the farm for winter season

loans.name: Flugence

texts.en:
Flugence is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop where he sells soap, salt and other products.

Apart from that, he also grows crops and works throughout the week. He has been a farmer for six years and in this way, he has been able to take very good care of his family.

His dream is to expand into a wholesale store, but he does not have enough capital to achieve his desire. He is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, salt, ripe bananas and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, ripe bananas and soap to sell.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Abdu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Abdu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Abdu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Abdu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Edah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Edah, who is a 49-year-old married woman with three sons. Edah has had a small shop selling base food for 25 years. In the photo, she is with her husband. 

Edah has asked for a loan of 7,200,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home in order to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Edah will be able to repay the loan received. She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home in order to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family.

loans.name: Vaaipu

texts.en: Vaaipu is a married woman of 49 years of old with 2 children. She runs a small business selling pork buns and chips in her community and has been doing this for 1 year. Vaaipu has requested a loan to buy a pot, fryer, bags of flour, sack of chicken and a vegetable oil. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vaaipu will use her profit to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a pot, fryer, bags of flour, sack of chicken and a vegetable oil

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma who is in her early 40's is divorced with three kids, who are still in school.She has been selling clothes at her shop for five years now.She works from 05am to 08pm daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwajuma's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.She used the previous loan to increasing clothes stock and has managed to pay back all her loan successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support. She used the profit to pay school fees for her kids, take care of her family and to repay a loan. She will use this loan to increase stock and to buy up to date clothes to sell. She dreams of being an international business woman.
Mwajuma will be responsible for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock and to buy up to date clothes to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, 38, is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilou has a business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines. Marilou requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, roll on, etc.. Marilou has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, roll on, etc.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
At the age of 29, Anna is a single mother of three children and looks after one other dependent, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

Anna trades in used clothes, mainly buying and selling to men and women. She is such a hardworking woman determined to raise and educate her children. She started the business nine years ago, and is proud of the progress, although challenged by increasing transport costs, competition and limited capital. She hopes to expand her business in the future and be able to open up a boutique in town, while her personal goals are to educate her children up to the university and to build a permanent residential house. 

Anna has requested a loan to buy clothes to sell as we are nearing Christmas time, when demand for clothes is always high.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
As a previous Kiva lender, Constance is looking to expand her business by being funded again.

Since her first loan, Constance has managed to successfully open a Zoona booth which she now runs herself. She has managed to employ two of her siblings to assist her in the running of this booth and they have managed to keep this booth running since June of 2015, however,  she is now looking to expand her business into other locations.
Currently, Constance uses the revenue generated by her Zoona outlet to pay for tuition for herself and her sister. Constance would like to someday become a qualified teacher as this would help with the shortage of teachers currently being experienced in Zambia. Her sister would like to become a wildlife biologist and Constance is paying towards making this dream a reality. 
Some of the challenges Constance currently experiences are shortages of float and having to pay tuition fees. Float shortages mean that she is unable to service her clients, which results in revenue dropping as well as clients losing faith in her services. Constance would therefore like a Kiva loan in order to boost her float and generate enough capital to expand her business into other locations. 

Being able to run her own business by having been able to open a Zoona outlet has allowed Constance to keep her family afloat, however, she is now looking to build on that capital base and progressively have her outlet become a more lucrative, sustainable business solution. This would ensure the long-term comfort and peace of mind of herself and those who depend on her, including his siblings as well as a large part of her community. 
On a broader spectrum, Constance would like to be able to give back to her community by not only creating employment opportunities and thus helping others achieve the same peace of mind she now currently enjoys, but also to be a viable, trustworthy alternative in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the working class. This would not only save her community member’s time, but it would also lower their expenses as this would reduce the need to travel long distances in order to send and receive money. She would also like to inspire other young women to become entrepreneurs in their own right and plough all that growth and development back into the community. 
Zoona has done market research and in so doing have found that the locations in which Constance is looking to open new outlets would be ideal not only for employment opportunities for those communities, but also to generate the traction she envisions for her business.

At the present time, Constance does not have the necessary capital needed to execute her vision and objective. Connecting with Kiva lenders would jump start her endeavour while simultaneously jump starting opportunities for future employees who are also looking to become entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to generate enough capital in order to expand her business into more locations and offer more employment opportunities which are very much needed.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 37-year-old hardworking married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda and has two children aged 10 and 6 years, who both attend school. He also has the responsibility of looking after two other dependents.

Denis deals in livestock rearing and also does building and construction work to supplement his income, which he uses to look after his family. His utmost vision is to advance his standards of living and have his two children educated, despite the fact that he faces a challenge of prolonged drought caused by heavy sunshine, leading to slow growth of his animals.

Denis hopes to expand his business into a bigger farm. He is requesting a loan to obtain more cows to sell.

loans.use: to obtain more cows to sell.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sjida is the age of 27 living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband owns a lolly pop (ice pop) making and packing factory. He has run a lolly pop making factory for 15 years to meet the family’s expenses. His salesmen distribute the lolly pops in the market.

Today Sjida’s husband wants to buy lolly pop raw materials, for example sugar, colour and essence etc.for proper income but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase lolly pop raw materials to earn an income.

Therefore Sjida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Sjida’s husband can purchase lolly pop’s raw materials.
Sjida and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's lolypop factory.

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is a 45 years old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation that grows ava and vegetables, that sells in her community and the market to earn a living. Kalala needs a loan to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds. She will use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. Kalala joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Mr Hiền is 28 years old and he is married. He has been operating a food stall selling fish sauce for 6 years. Hiền lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Hiền first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. He hopes that this loan could make his little dream come true.
In the future, Hiền hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old, married and has four children. Two of her children are still attending school, ages 12 and 20 years old, respectively. Her husband has an income that can help defray the family's daily expenses.

Josephine owns an eatery locally known as "carenderia".  She prepares and sells home meals. She needs additional capital to boost her income. She would like to prepare and sell a variety of meals that are affordable to the locals in her place. Josephine decided to buy supplies like soft drinks, rice  and ingredients like vegetables, meat and condiments. Thus, slowly her income will improve and she could settle her obligation.

loans.use: to buy supplies like soft drinks, rice and ingredients like vegetables, meat and condiments

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread,flour, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar and other items. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman and is 34 years old now. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Janice has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, like spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

Janice has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver lives in Vahagni village of Lori region with his parents, wife and two children who currently attend school. 

Nver runs a farm where he is mostly engaged in aviculture, fish-breeding and land cultivation. Nver has been also providing transportation services using his own truck for over 10 years. Last year, he purchased a new truck and sold his old one, so the service he provides is now more secure. The requested loan will help Nver to cover expenses of the truck purchase and will let Nver think about providing proper nutrition for his family.

loans.use: to pay for the expenses of the truck purchase and continue providing transportation service, so his family will have an opportunity to cover basic daily expenses

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a widowed mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Akbariah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients,Akbariah, who is a 45-year-old married with three sons. Akbariah has been selling waste for recycling for twenty years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Akbariah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family. .

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is a rural widower father of a married son and lives with his son's family of five and together they've been doing agriculture/livestock and also keeping bees for all these past 20 years. Currently, they got two dairy cows, five goats, ten sheep and fourteen beehives and also some agricultural land where they mainly plant corn for the livestock.

The income of the family comes from the sales of the fresh raw milk and homemade products including cheese/cottage cheese and butter and also from the sale of honey and little animals that they sell at some farmer's market in a nearby town. "We work all day and everyday, me, my son and my three grandsons. Rural life and its activities are not easy at all. Our village is far from the urban area and the markets," said Arif to the loan officer in the interview.

Arif needs this loan to buy some replacement parts for the agricultural tractor that his family owns.

loans.use: to buy some replacement parts for the tractor, which is needed for his farm

loans.name: Soloniaina Lynah Ravaka

texts.fr:
Soloniaina  a 29 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari exerce la même activité qu'elle. Le couple a trois enfants âgés respectivement de 14-8-4 ans et scolarisés dans une école privée. C’est une  femme  leader  animée d’un esprit d’entreprise. Le couple vit dans leur propre maison, leur rêve est de pouvoir acquérir d’autres terrains et construire d’autres maisons qui seront légués à leurs trois fils, l’éducation de leurs trois enfants étant leur priorité.
 Soloniaina a commencé l’activité de vente de divers articles et accessoires en 2008. Elle dispose déjà tant d'années d'expérience dans l’activité de petit commerce, avant, elle gérait une petite épicerie. Elle n’a pas cessé de rechercher des moyens pour développer l’activité de petit commerce en diversifiant et augmentant les articles et en cherchant des points de vente.Le succès d’une activité de petit commerce dépend de la diversification des articles et accessoires  à vendre.
texts.en:
Soloniaina is 29 years old. She is married, and her husband work in the same business as she. The couple have three children, aged 14, 8, and 4, respectively, in private school. She is an expressive leader with an enterprising spirit.

The couple live in their own house. Their dream is to acquire more plots of land and build more houses to be handed down to their three sons, whose education is their priority.

Soloniaina began her business selling various goods and accessories in 2008. She already has so many years of experience in small-scale commerce. Before, she used to manage a small grocery store. She has continuously looked for the means to develop her little business by diversifying and increasing the items and by researching sales outlets. Success with such a business depends on diversifying the items and accessories to be sold.

loans.use: to purchase kits, mobile phone batteries, ear phones, chargers, and wristwatches.

loans.name: Marichel

texts.en:
Marichel is a 40-year-old married woman who owns and operates a tricycle (rickshaw) transportation services for 10 years. She has four children ages 11-months-old to 18 years old respectively. She earns a living through the rent she impose on a daily basis.
Together with her family, she lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

Her tricycle is under repair and she needs funds to answer the urgency.

She decided to avail the loan to pay for tricycle repair and purchase hub (enclosed cabin rigidly attached).
With these, she would be able to completely finish renovating her tricycle . Thus, it will provide comfort and safety as it transports passengers again.

She is hoping that she could be able to set some of the money for future use, to expand her livelihood and support the schooling of her children for brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to pay for  tricycle repair and purchase hub (enclosed cabin rigidly attached).

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a carpentry where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials
